excerpts: I did get the drip coffee and it was good and strong.
drip coffee.author: Jen T.
drip coffee.review: I was looking for a place to grab a quick bite with my kids after a visit from the Academy of Sciences. I ordered the avocado toast with no peppers and the waffle. After what seemed like a long wait, the toast came with peppers. I didn't feel like waiting another 10 mins to have them fix it. I ended up eating the toast as my kids didn't like pepper so they ate the waffle. Overall, I would probably not order the food again. I did get the drip coffee and it was good and strong.

excerpts: Stopped by here for the cold brew which was pretty good.
cold brew.author: Alan H.
cold brew.review:
Cute cafe off the beaten path. Stopped by here for the cold brew which was pretty good. 

Staff was slow and not friendly.  They seemed more interested in talking with their coworkers and friends not purchasing anything rather than helping customers. No seats were available on the late morning. Seems like it gets a lot of people working from "home" on their laptops. They need to find a way to move people every couple hours if they want more business. 

Only street parking is available...good luck!

excerpts:
($4-$5)

Cold brew:
cold brew.author: Yuan Z.
cold brew.review:
Shop: Super cute! There are seatings but you may have to share the tables with others. There are a couple spots for electric outlets, which is a plus! 

Bathroom: Get a code from the cashier. It's clean! 

Staff: Super nice and friendly. The orders were made pretty quickly as well. 

Avocado toast: The best one I've ever had. The avocado is mushed, well seasoned, and nicely spread. The toast was crunchy on the sides and soft on the inside. ($9ish)

Breakfast something Sandwich: The aioli sauce on it gave the sandwich a great taste. Everything was just a perfect combination with the buns, the cheese, the egg and the bacon. ($7ish)

Salted caramel latte: Tasted amazing. ($4-$5)

Cold brew: They didn't cold brew it right then and there. It was in a jug which was in the fridge. However, it actually still tasted great. ($4-$5)

WiFi password can be requested. 

I would totally come back. This is my new favorite coffee shop to get work done and fill my belly!

excerpts: Mint Cold Brew ($5) -
Kind of tastes like the mint mojito coffee at Philz, but with homemade mint syrup!
Minty, smooth, and strong!
cold brew.author: Cecille W.
cold brew.review:
Cute and busy neighborhood coffee shop with a variety of food! 

Mint Cold Brew ($5) - Kind of tastes like the mint mojito coffee at Philz, but with homemade mint syrup! Minty, smooth, and strong! A great iced coffee. 

Vanilla Latte with soy ($4) - +$0.60 for soy. Light and creamy latte with a good amount of foam and vanilla flavor. Not too sweet. Loved this although I wish I ventured out and tried one of their specialty lattes! 

Pesto Toast ($6.75) - Thick (but soft) toast with melted cheese, tomatoes, and slices of pepperoni. Loooved this, and reasonably priced. 

Breakfast bunwich Sandwich ($7.50) - Pretty decent sandwich, with bacon, boiled egg, avocado, and thousand island dressing, but I would say it's a little overpriced for the size of it. Comes warm wrapped in foil. 

Avocado toast ($9.25) - I really really love avocado toast but I can't justify the price of this! Almost $10 for a thick piece of toast, soft boiled egg, and chili flakes. Although this was delicious, it's definitely overpriced compared to other places where I paid around $7 for the same thing. You can choose either a fried egg or soft boiled. 

For two people our total was $33, which we thought was a bit expensive for everything but we enjoyed our breakfast nonetheless. Very cute interior with a good amount of tables and seating. Definitely want to try the matcha waffles and specialty lattes next time!

excerpts: Peanut Butter Latte and Mint Cold Brew.
The big, beautifully golden brown crispy disks of Chocolate Chip Cookie in their case also looked really tempting
Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte.
I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together
but there is sorcery in this
and it totally works.
Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte.
I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together
but there is sorcery in this
and it totally works.
cold brew.author: Sarah J.
cold brew.review:
I stopped in Rise & Grind today after chilling out over at Lands End. I decided to go with 2 unusual drinks because why not? Today was grey and misty and required extra caffeine in unusual flavors: Peanut Butter Latte and Mint Cold Brew. The big, beautifully golden brown crispy disks of Chocolate Chip Cookie in their case also looked really tempting but I stuck to liquids today.

Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte. I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together but there is sorcery in this and it totally works. Refreshing yet invigorating ;-) 

The staff are super friendly, thank you! Great service always appreciated!

There are a few of those annoying hover-and-fly-in-eye-level-circles flies that seem to haunt San Francisco entryways, but I think those petty pests would linger inside a hospital lobby too. What is their deal?! Maybe some fly paper hidden off to the side would entrap them... I can dream. 

Bonus Points: A few loaded bookshelves inset high up on a wall -- and lots of community artwork. Cool! But did I miss a ladder or how do you get a book? You'd have to be a Shaq O'Neal to reach them if you stood on a chair. But maybe I needed more caffeine to accurately judge book-hopping. Or they are decorative books. I can dig it.

Coffee & mint. Check it out! Peace, dudes and dudettes.

excerpts:
(and it is good coffee - especially like the Cold Brew)
+ Food is really really good - try everything
cold brew.author: Mitch M.
cold brew.review:
Rise & Grind, San Francisco!

This place is always humming and chill at the same time. The staff and ownership team are super friendly and have created one of the best cafe experiences in San Franisco, right in our wonderful Inner Richmond neighborhood.

+ Coffee options aplenty (and it is good coffee - especially like the Cold Brew)
+ Food is really really good - try everything
+ Atmosphere is perfect for a quick bite/drink, conversation or private study session
+ Location is right off park and central to any Inner Richmond resident

Thanks for existing Rise & Grind, and for making life a little better.

excerpts: I highly recommend the mint cold brew, which has a nice subtle mint flavor and isn't bitter like regular black coffee.
cold brew.author: KC W.
cold brew.review:
My new favorite study spot!! I usually never drink coffee because it tends to just put me to sleep (yes I'm weird, I know) but I actually feel caffeinated with their drinks. I highly recommend the mint cold brew, which has a nice subtle mint flavor and isn't bitter like regular black coffee. The creme brûlée latte is delicious as well - not overly sweet, and they even torch the drink just like regular creme brûlée. 

They also have toasts and pastries not displayed on the menu above the register. I've only tried the pesto toast, and while it was a little pricey at $6.50, it was very tasty. I liked that the pesto wasn't incredibly oily and that the tomatoes and pepperoni were evenly distributed throughout, and I loved how the crispy crust contrasted with the fluffy inside of the bread. The avocado toast seems to be a popular item as well, although I haven't tried it. Food can be a little slow to come out, but they're very accommodating of any special requests. 

The atmosphere of this coffeeshop definitely bumps up my rating to five stars. The owners are both super friendly and welcoming as soon as customers walk in the door, and the decorations are so unique. I especially like the signs in the restroom and randomly misspelled words hanging on the walls LOL. However, the absolute best part is Cory, the owners' pet corgi!! He's social and very distracting when I'm trying to get work done, but also incredibly well behaved. There's not a whole lot of seating but it's spacious enough for people to do work, and they have a bunch of power strips lining the walls too.

Bottom line: strong coffee, delicious food, cute puppy!

cold brew.author: Jacquelyn T.
cold brew.review:
A really great local spot that adds to the Richmond. Popular with students and techies.

- Locally owned, I *believe* the owners are from the Richmond/are SF natives
- Tons of work space and outlets, they're incredibly laptop friendly (no charge per hour for wifi, additional power strips, etc). Mix of bar, small table, and community seating.
- "Fun" lattes such as whopper, black sesame, peanut butter, etc. Not in my preference, but very trendy. They also have other interesting drinks such as a mint cold brew
- Nice variety of food options. Different pastries, toasts, and sandwiches.
- The interior is a mix of "hipster" and less pretentious, quirky, and almost mismatched superhero and literature themed. Haha.
- The owners sometimes have their corgi here!

excerpts: Mint cold brew?
It had me buzzing for hours!
I most recently tried the affogato and it had 2 scoops of ice cream and silky smooth espresso.
They're super friendly here
and you can always count on great service.
I've also had a couple of their snacks, which are the perfect compliment to your coffee.
I do wish some people working on their computers would share space more so others coming in can sit and enjoy the space.
Parking can be tough on some days, but it's definitely worth it.
cold brew.author: Aaron Y.
cold brew.review: YES! Rise & Grind has awesome drinks! Creme brulee latte? ummmm, Yes! Mint cold brew? It had me buzzing for hours! I most recently tried the affogato and it had 2 scoops of ice cream and silky smooth espresso. They're super friendly here and you can always count on great service. I've also had a couple of their snacks, which are the perfect compliment to your coffee. I do wish some people working on their computers would share space more so others coming in can sit and enjoy the space. Parking can be tough on some days, but it's definitely worth it.

excerpts: Cold brew hit the spot.
I saw a young woman sitting in the corner and made an assumption that she worked here, and I assumed correctly.
Michelle?
Rochelle?
No, it's Vashelle.
Oh hey.
Come here before rising and grinding or after grinding and rising *wink*, and show some coffee love.
cold brew.author: Linda N.
cold brew.review:
I heard about this place through word of mouth.  I was meeting up a friend but realized I was 30 minutes early so I decided to make a coffee run.  

Cold brew hit the spot.  I saw a young woman sitting in the corner and made an assumption that she worked here, and I assumed correctly.  Michelle?  Rochelle?  No, it's Vashelle.  Oh hey.  Come here before rising and grinding or after grinding and rising *wink*, and show some coffee love.  Shout out to Vashelle and the rest of the Rise & Grind crew and welcome to the neighborhood!

Good coffee, friendly service, cute Dr. Seuss quotes stamped on the floor.

excerpts: My favorite drink on their menu is the Mint Cold Brew.
I also really like their Creme Brûlée Latte as well.
cold brew.author: John M.
cold brew.review:
By far one of my most favorite coffee shops and places to chill in The City. It all starts with the owners, Vee & V. The way they take the time to get to know each every single customer who walks through their doors shows just how invested in they are. 

Their drinks and food are always made to order, it may take longer than some shops but you can taste the difference. My favorite drink on their menu is the Mint Cold Brew. I also really like their Creme Brûlée Latte as well. For food, their avocado toast is always smackin!! Fresh bread, nice avocados & delivered right to your table with knife & fork. What else could you ask for?

This trip I special ordered Waffles: half matcha with ice cream on side & half ube with extra ube on side. Let's say I was no where near disappointed. Crackin! If you're in the hood drop by & check out what they're selling because you won't leave sad. 

Oh, plenty of plugs, seating, and strong Wifi. Not to mention Cori the Corgi

excerpts: The mint cold brew was really good nice balance of mint and coffee even without cream

cold brew.review: Found this cute little coffee shop and they have excellent coffee. The mint cold brew was really good nice balance of mint and coffee even without cream

cold brew.review: Their cold brew is STRONG just how I like it. The baristas are nice and the place is maintained well. I didn't really notice their food items but they keep their beverage menu simple. Will definitely come back.

excerpts: We sampled their cold brew coffee.
Omgoooooosh...
It actually taste like coffee... not like that water downed stuff made at the mainstream cafe'(s).
Their brew is full of flavor and can be customized to your standard.
cold brew.author: Jeremy B.
cold brew.review:
A hidden jewel and a must try. 

Located right next to the park, it's the perfect pick-me-up location for anytime during day! 

Prepare yourself coffee enthusiast. The coffee / espresso is on point. Extra delicious and full of flavor...
Their barista's make exceptional Latte Art. Be sure to ask :)  Excellent Photo opportunities ! 

A "little heart" goes a long way. Thank you for providing a great experience and for sharing the beautiful latte art. Their cappuccino = Exceptional 

We sampled their cold brew coffee. Omgoooooosh... It actually taste like coffee... not like that water downed stuff made at the mainstream cafe'(s). Their brew is full of flavor and can be customized to your standard. Absolutely perfect for a hot day. 


Try their delicious, freshly made waffle(s). Extra fluffy and crisp on the edges. mmm


Warm ambiance and beautiful interior design. Besides the grinding of the beans and hiss of the milk steamers, it wasn't too loud in there. Rise & Grind is perfect for meet and greets AND for grinding out what seemed to be an endless array of emails. 

What are you waiting for?!? Add this location to your coffee bucket list !

excerpts: Their cold brew actually taste like coffee and not iced water + milk like most places.
cold brew.author: Napoleon T.
cold brew.review:
Skilled baristas, Pinterest decor, and welcoming service. 

Quality cup of coffee. Their cold brew actually taste like coffee and not iced water + milk like most places. 

Everything you can ask for in a coffee shop.

excerpts: i often get the mint cold brew or creme brulee latte.
the food is good too--love the waffles!
the wifi is pretty fast and holds up for what i need to get done so i have no complaints.
there's ample seating and outlets.
love how open the space is even if its a smaller cafe.
cold brew.author: Alison M.
cold brew.review:
i always spend one of my days off in a cafe to work on personal projects and rise and grind is by far my favorite one. it's in a good location near my apartment and there's always space for me and my laptop. the baristas are always very welcoming and watching the steady stream of customers they seem to know a lot of them! the drinks are pretty consistent and very tasty. i often get the mint cold brew or creme brulee latte. the food is good too--love the waffles! the wifi is pretty fast and holds up for what i need to get done so i have no complaints. there's ample seating and outlets. love how open the space is even if its a smaller cafe. the large windows let in a lot of natural light and opens up the space a bit too. 

big plus is cori the corgi makes an appearance every so often. the cutest pup around! happy to give cori belly rubs at any opportunity!

excerpts: We got the mint cold brew which was good, not too minty but still had a hint.
The service was very upsetting we got such snooty vibes from all of them.
Prices are ok.
We will not be going back.
cold brew.author: Jasmin L.
cold brew.review: Came across this place and was so excited to try it. Very disappointed. My boyfriend and I ordered the matcha waffle, the girl got our order wrong and gave us a snooty attitude saying she "heard Belgian." The waffle was ok, gave us very little syrup so it was a bit dry. We got the mint cold brew which was good, not too minty but still had a hint. The service was very upsetting we got such snooty vibes from all of them. Prices are ok. We will not be going back.

excerpts:
Cold brew: 5 stars, pure coffee taste without any sourness or bitterness

Spicy chai tea latte: 5 stars, love the extra punch of flavor from the ginger

Will be back!
cold brew.author: Hazel J.
cold brew.review:
Great little coffee place with friendly staff

Got the following:

Cold brew: 5 stars, pure coffee taste without any sourness or bitterness

Spicy chai tea latte: 5 stars, love the extra punch of flavor from the ginger

Will be back!

excerpts:
My wife and I came here and got an Organic Seven Bridges pour over, a cold brew, and the avocado toast. 

The cold brew was equally as good. 

The avocado toast really stole the show though.
cold brew.author: Connor O.
cold brew.review:
This new coffee house is awesome. My wife and I came here and got an Organic Seven Bridges pour over, a cold brew, and the avocado toast. 

The coffee was excellent. Balanced, flavorful, and not sour or bitter. The cold brew was equally as good. 

The avocado toast really stole the show though. It came out on 1-inch thick pieces of toasted white bread with an avocado spread that reminded me of deviled eggs (I think they whip the avocado with mayo and some light mustard seed) and a perfectly cooked soft-boiled egg. 

This place also gets top marks for customer service! They were super friendly with our pooch, giving her treats and they were friendly and engaging during and after the transaction. 

Overall, we love our new neighborhood coffee shop. We will absolutely be coming here regularly.

excerpts: I have yet to order any of the food or fancy lattes, however, I do get the cold brew and it's very good and strong!
If you are a huge dog lover like me, the owners bring in their pet Corgi named Cori who is adorably friendly and minds his business.
Also, the staff is incredibly personable.
I've noticed that they greet every customer that comes in and asks how everything tasted before you head out, a rare experience for a coffee shop in the city!
Highly recommend whether you're looking for a drink to-go, to get work done, or for a conversation over some good coffee with a friend
cold brew.author: Tricia Angela L.
cold brew.review:
Absolutely love Rise & Grind! I've been on the hunt for the perfect cafe to study: somewhere not too loud, a chill environment, and most importantly great coffee. 
Rise & Grind has gone beyond my standards! It's a great place to study as, on a weekday, it doesn't get overwhelmingly loud and busy. They also keep their music at a lower volume, so it's a nice place to read. The environment is always clean and there's a good amount of tables to sit and chat or like me, set up your laptop to study. 
I have yet to order any of the food or fancy lattes, however, I do get the cold brew and it's very good and strong!
If you are a huge dog lover like me, the owners bring in their pet Corgi named Cori who is adorably friendly and minds his business. Also, the staff is incredibly personable. I've noticed that they greet every customer that comes in and asks how everything tasted before you head out, a rare experience for a coffee shop in the city! Highly recommend whether you're looking for a drink to-go, to get work done, or for a conversation over some good coffee with a friend

excerpts: I've also tasted their cold brew and that tasted exactly the same (like bitter water).
The coffee is definitely not good, but I leave them a tip anyway because the service is that good.
So, if you can, come and chill and order some food...but you may want to hit up some other place for a coffee.
Or do what I do, go back home and make Viet coffee.
cold brew.author: Cathy V.
cold brew.review: This place used to be known as something else and OMG it was terrible before! Now that it's changed to Rise&Grind, it's MUCH BETTER! The workers are always extremely friendly and, as someone who is very indecisive, they never put pressure on me to hurry. The place looks kind of hipster, but it definitely feels like the old SF (friendly, unique, dog-friendly, and makes everyone feel welcome). The waffles seemed to be a MUST-TRY because every time I go in I see people eating them. I decided to try one of their waffles and it definitely is pretty tasty. My only complaint is their coffee sucks (ironic, isn't it?). Yes, their coffee is terrible. A $4 cup of cappuccino was extremely small and tasted like bitter water. I've also tasted their cold brew and that tasted exactly the same (like bitter water). The coffee is definitely not good, but I leave them a tip anyway because the service is that good. So, if you can, come and chill and order some food...but you may want to hit up some other place for a coffee. Or do what I do, go back home and make Viet coffee.

excerpts: I've only had the americano and the mint cold brew so far
but I'll definitely be back!
Super yummy toasts and their pastries looked great.
Extremely friendly staff.
You won't regret coming here!
cold brew.author: Kylee P.
cold brew.review: SF is full of great coffee shops and this one is no exception. It's a great place to study/work and get a really delicious drink. I've only had the americano and the mint cold brew so far but I'll definitely be back! Super yummy toasts and their pastries looked great. Extremely friendly staff. You won't regret coming here!

excerpts: My usual go to is the cold brew, avocado toast, and the beer & bacon muffin.
I can't recommend this place enough!
cold brew.author: Richard W.
cold brew.review: I love coming to Rise and Grind to either work, read, or grab coffee with a friend. The cafe has a modern industrial look to it and has a very comfortable atmosphere to it. The staff and owners, Vy and Vashelle, are beyond amazing and friendly people. They will go the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied and happy. Rise & Grind serves delicious coffee, pastries, and toast. My usual go to is the cold brew, avocado toast, and the beer & bacon muffin. I can't recommend this place enough!

excerpts: The mint iced cold brew is my favorite.
cold brew.author: J T.
cold brew.review: This place is the best! The owners V and Vashelle are super nice and attentive.  The mint iced cold brew is my favorite.  Can't wait to try the peanut butter latte.  The pastries from Devil's Teeth are exquisite.  So happy they opened in my neighborhood and I look forward to going there all the time!

excerpts: Will definitely by coming back to try their mint cold brew...
cold brew.author: Megan W.
cold brew.review: The Whopper Latte here started my Saturday off great! The Belgian waffle was fluffy and complemented it perfectly. Friendly staff, local art, handmade benches- all the elements of a great cafe! Will definitely by coming back to try their mint cold brew...

excerpts: I ordered the Creme Brulee Latte ($5) which to my surprise came out with a crunchy caramelized top just like a creme brulee!
It was sweet, might be too sweet for some, so I personally wouldn't order it again.
creme brulee latte.author: Tiffany N.
creme brulee latte.review:
*Came here on a Wednesday around 1pm and stayed until 3. During this time the cafe was quiet and mostly empty, which was perfect for getting some work done. There was plenty of seats, so no need to fight over tables. 

*There were a few items on the menu that looked unique. I ordered the Creme Brulee Latte ($5) which to my surprise came out with a crunchy caramelized top just like a creme brulee! It was sweet, might be too sweet for some, so I personally wouldn't order it again. I also ordered a Pesto Toast ($7) which was yummy! Pesto, Cheese, Pepperoni, Tomatoes...It tasted like a slice of pesto pizza lol

*Service was friendly. My drink came out quickly and my food came out maybe 10 minutes later. You clean up your own table at the end. 

* I got lucky and parking was easy to find during the weekday/work hours. However, I can imagine that it might not always be the case, and might need to find parking a few blocks away next time.

excerpts: Creme brulee latte?
Pumpkin spice lattee (made from scratch?)
Sign me up.
creme brulee latte.author: Cindy W.
creme brulee latte.review:
I really like this cafe! I'm not a coffee snob but I liked the cafe for its working ambiance. I easily spent a few hours here working away. Their menu is pretty inventive and casual. Creme brulee latte? Pumpkin spice lattee (made from scratch?) Sign me up. I also ordered a BLT ($7.50 - not too unreasonable) and it was delicious. 

Great wifi. Good for working. Would come back here again if I'm wandering near Golden Gate Park. 

Service is a tad slow... especially for BLT. I would expect a little better but overall it's a cool neat find.

excerpts: I ordered a cup of Creme Brulee latte, I loved it!
I stayed there for an hour
and I wish I could have stayed longer, but my dog was getting nervous.
So, I had to leave.
I will come again!
creme brulee latte.author: Jimmy B.
creme brulee latte.review:
Love this charming coffee shop close to my house. 

I came in with my Corgi and sat in. It is a dog-friendly place! 
The customer service was friendly and polite. I ordered a cup of Creme Brulee latte, I loved it! I stayed there for an hour and I wish I could have stayed longer, but my dog was getting nervous. So, I had to leave. I will come again!

excerpts: Rise & Grind makes a creme brulee latte and a special's menu Biscoff cookie butter latte that are decadent and delicious.
creme brulee latte.author: Deanna Y.
creme brulee latte.review:
Coffee and corgis are a few of my favorite things. Starting the day off with both of these? Total win. After a few visits, Rise & Grind has become one of my favorite coffee shops...and it's not just because of Cori the corgi - promise! 

I'm a sucker for specialty lattes, especially creative ones that you can't find anywhere else. Rise & Grind makes a creme brulee latte and a special's menu Biscoff cookie butter latte that are decadent and delicious. Perfect if you have a sweet tooth like me!

Avocado toast, matcha waffles, and bacon, avocado, aioli breakfast sandwiches are amongst some of the tasty options available for your snacking needs. 

Walls adorned with art. Friendly owner and servers. Seating available for coffee-sipping conversations and laptop lounging. Food orders can take awhile, but it's usually because they get pretty busy. Solid coffee shop and a great addition to the neighborhood!

excerpts: Creme brulee latte?
ummmm, Yes!
creme brulee latte.author: Aaron Y.
creme brulee latte.review: YES! Rise & Grind has awesome drinks! Creme brulee latte? ummmm, Yes! Mint cold brew? It had me buzzing for hours! I most recently tried the affogato and it had 2 scoops of ice cream and silky smooth espresso. They're super friendly here and you can always count on great service. I've also had a couple of their snacks, which are the perfect compliment to your coffee. I do wish some people working on their computers would share space more so others coming in can sit and enjoy the space. Parking can be tough on some days, but it's definitely worth it.

excerpts: I had the creme brulee latte which was awesome!
I love how they burnt the top - it added that burnt marshmallow flavor.
I also had their waffles which was also pretty good.
The location is great
but I do wish they were a bit bigger inside.
Other than that this is a great cafe!
creme brulee latte.author: Mikayla M.
creme brulee latte.review: Long overdue review but I visited this cafe a couple months ago with a friend.  I had the creme brulee latte which was awesome!  I love how they burnt the top - it added that burnt marshmallow flavor.  I also had their waffles which was also pretty good.  The location is great but I do wish they were a bit bigger inside.  Other than that this is a great cafe!

excerpts: This time, I finally tried their creme brulee latte.
Oh.
My. GOD.
Tasted like coffee creme brulee.
creme brulee latte.author: Evelyn C.
creme brulee latte.review:
Recently decided to have a "work from home" day and trekked over to Rise & Grind to see whether they've made any updates.

Now it's five stars! They started putting up some art on the walls, which helps a lot in warming up the space. Service was stellar, as I remembered. 

This time, I finally tried their creme brulee latte. Oh. My. GOD. Tasted like coffee creme brulee. Too addicting. 

I also tried their smashed avocado and poached egg on toast. Yum.

There's plenty of working space as well, so there was a mix of people there, from college students to those living in the neighborhood to those playing "hooky" from work (mind you, I wasn't REALLY playing hooky...I was still working!). 

Highly recommend.

excerpts: Creme brulee latte was expertly done.

creme brulee latte.review: Creme brulee latte was expertly done. And their matcha waffle was an elegant classic. On a sunday midmorning, it was packed. Kinda pricey, bur worth the splurge for great and creative coffees.

excerpts: They have a variety of specialty drinks like the creme brulee latte, cookie butter latte and their newly added Richmond chill, which is their version of Vietnamese coffee with espresso and condensed milk shaken up in a cocktail mixer.
creme brulee latte.author: Niko L.
creme brulee latte.review:
Rise & Grind is without a doubt the best coffee/tea shop in the Richmond District quite possibly in San Francisco. Everything on the menu from the food to the drinks is delicious, but it's all also uniquely one of a kind. I live down the street from Rise & Grind and couldn't have been more pleased to have a local coffee spot with great food and even nicer employees open when they did a few months ago. They have a variety of specialty drinks like the creme brulee latte, cookie butter latte and their newly added Richmond chill, which is their version of Vietnamese coffee with espresso and condensed milk shaken up in a cocktail mixer. If you're not a big coffee drinker I highly recommend the London fog.

I've tried almost all of the food items and have to put the Avocado Toast at the top of the list; a delicious thick piece of toast topped with a nice hearty spread of fresh avocado, red chili flakes, and a soft boiled egg. It will surely leave you full for hours. The breakfast biscuit is another one of my favorites as well as the Pesto Toast (AMAZING), but their variety of waffles if especially delicious and one of a kind. My favorite is the Matcha waffle. Try it, you're taste buds will thank me.

Along with all the great menu items, the environment and staff are something that makes Rise & Grind especially enjoyable for me. The owners have gone out of their way to put local artists work on the walls and the business has a number of regulars you'll often see every time you go in. There's a great communal and hospitable vibe that keeps me coming back for more. To add to all the greatness of Rise & Grind, there is Cori the corgi, the resident dog who sets up camp at the spot every day and greets customers with a big smile. He's always willing to be played with and adds to the greatness of the baristas. If I could, I'd give Rise & Grind 10 stars but Yelp only lets me give 5. This is a must try coffee spot if you're in the neighborhood or go through this part of town.

excerpts: I got a regular cappucino and my girlfriend got the creme brulee latte.
The cappucino was smooth, nicely pulled, and she wrote my name on the latte art :).
The creme brulee latte is a sweet latte with a hard sugary coating on top, like creme brulee.
The barista actually used a blowtorch to caramelize the sugar after she poured the milk.
Will definitely be back again to sample their other drinks and pastries.
creme brulee latte.author: Eric W.
creme brulee latte.review: Finally, a legit coffee place in the Richmond district! I got a regular cappucino and my girlfriend got the creme brulee latte. The cappucino was smooth, nicely pulled, and she wrote my name on the latte art :). The creme brulee latte is a sweet latte with a hard sugary coating on top, like creme brulee. The barista actually used a blowtorch to caramelize the sugar after she poured the milk. Will definitely be back again to sample their other drinks and pastries.

excerpts: Get the creme brulee latte!!
I got it with soy milk
but it is really good.
They use the blow torch to burn the top of the drink.
It reminds me of the creme brulee at LA Mill.
Cute location right by Golden Gate park and Fulton Street in the Richmond district.
Cute tables and chairs.
Parking may be a bit hard as there is nothing much (other stores, etc) in the area so its all residential
but you may be able to find a spot along the park on Fulton Street.
I had to park a few blocks away near Safeway.
I am looking forward to going back and trying other specialty drinks.

creme brulee latte.review: Get the creme brulee latte!! I got it with soy milk but it is really good. They use the blow torch to burn the top of the drink. excerpts: Mint Cold Brew ($5) -
Kind of tastes like the mint mojito coffee at Philz, but with homemade mint syrup!
Minty, smooth, and strong!
mint cold brew.author: Cecille W.
mint cold brew.review:
Cute and busy neighborhood coffee shop with a variety of food! 

Mint Cold Brew ($5) - Kind of tastes like the mint mojito coffee at Philz, but with homemade mint syrup! Minty, smooth, and strong! A great iced coffee. 

Vanilla Latte with soy ($4) - +$0.60 for soy. Light and creamy latte with a good amount of foam and vanilla flavor. Not too sweet. Loved this although I wish I ventured out and tried one of their specialty lattes! 

Pesto Toast ($6.75) - Thick (but soft) toast with melted cheese, tomatoes, and slices of pepperoni. Loooved this, and reasonably priced. 

Breakfast bunwich Sandwich ($7.50) - Pretty decent sandwich, with bacon, boiled egg, avocado, and thousand island dressing, but I would say it's a little overpriced for the size of it. Comes warm wrapped in foil. 

Avocado toast ($9.25) - I really really love avocado toast but I can't justify the price of this! Almost $10 for a thick piece of toast, soft boiled egg, and chili flakes. Although this was delicious, it's definitely overpriced compared to other places where I paid around $7 for the same thing. You can choose either a fried egg or soft boiled. 

For two people our total was $33, which we thought was a bit expensive for everything but we enjoyed our breakfast nonetheless. Very cute interior with a good amount of tables and seating. Definitely want to try the matcha waffles and specialty lattes next time!

excerpts: Peanut Butter Latte and Mint Cold Brew.
The big, beautifully golden brown crispy disks of Chocolate Chip Cookie in their case also looked really tempting
Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte.
I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together
but there is sorcery in this
and it totally works.

I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together
but there is sorcery in this
and it totally works.
mint cold brew.author: Sarah J.
mint cold brew.review:
I stopped in Rise & Grind today after chilling out over at Lands End. I decided to go with 2 unusual drinks because why not? Today was grey and misty and required extra caffeine in unusual flavors: Peanut Butter Latte and Mint Cold Brew. The big, beautifully golden brown crispy disks of Chocolate Chip Cookie in their case also looked really tempting but I stuck to liquids today.

Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte. I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together but there is sorcery in this and it totally works. Refreshing yet invigorating ;-) 

The staff are super friendly, thank you! Great service always appreciated!

There are a few of those annoying hover-and-fly-in-eye-level-circles flies that seem to haunt San Francisco entryways, but I think those petty pests would linger inside a hospital lobby too. What is their deal?! Maybe some fly paper hidden off to the side would entrap them... I can dream. 

Bonus Points: A few loaded bookshelves inset high up on a wall -- and lots of community artwork. Cool! But did I miss a ladder or how do you get a book? You'd have to be a Shaq O'Neal to reach them if you stood on a chair. But maybe I needed more caffeine to accurately judge book-hopping. Or they are decorative books. I can dig it.

Coffee & mint. Check it out! Peace, dudes and dudettes.

excerpts: I highly recommend the mint cold brew, which has a nice subtle mint flavor and isn't bitter like regular black coffee.
mint cold brew.author: KC W.
mint cold brew.review:
My new favorite study spot!! I usually never drink coffee because it tends to just put me to sleep (yes I'm weird, I know) but I actually feel caffeinated with their drinks. I highly recommend the mint cold brew, which has a nice subtle mint flavor and isn't bitter like regular black coffee. The creme brûlée latte is delicious as well - not overly sweet, and they even torch the drink just like regular creme brûlée. 

They also have toasts and pastries not displayed on the menu above the register. I've only tried the pesto toast, and while it was a little pricey at $6.50, it was very tasty. I liked that the pesto wasn't incredibly oily and that the tomatoes and pepperoni were evenly distributed throughout, and I loved how the crispy crust contrasted with the fluffy inside of the bread. The avocado toast seems to be a popular item as well, although I haven't tried it. Food can be a little slow to come out, but they're very accommodating of any special requests. 

The atmosphere of this coffeeshop definitely bumps up my rating to five stars. The owners are both super friendly and welcoming as soon as customers walk in the door, and the decorations are so unique. I especially like the signs in the restroom and randomly misspelled words hanging on the walls LOL. However, the absolute best part is Cory, the owners' pet corgi!! He's social and very distracting when I'm trying to get work done, but also incredibly well behaved. There's not a whole lot of seating but it's spacious enough for people to do work, and they have a bunch of power strips lining the walls too.

Bottom line: strong coffee, delicious food, cute puppy!

mint cold brew.review:
A really great local spot that adds to the Richmond. Popular with students and techies.

- Locally owned, I *believe* the owners are from the Richmond/are SF natives
- Tons of work space and outlets, they're incredibly laptop friendly (no charge per hour for wifi, additional power strips, etc). Mix of bar, small table, and community seating.
- "Fun" lattes such as whopper, black sesame, peanut butter, etc. Not in my preference, but very trendy. They also have other interesting drinks such as a mint cold brew
- Nice variety of food options. Different pastries, toasts, and sandwiches.
- The interior is a mix of "hipster" and less pretentious, quirky, and almost mismatched superhero and literature themed. Haha.
- The owners sometimes have their corgi here!

excerpts: Mint cold brew?
It had me buzzing for hours!
I most recently tried the affogato and it had 2 scoops of ice cream and silky smooth espresso.
They're super friendly here
and you can always count on great service.
I've also had a couple of their snacks, which are the perfect compliment to your coffee.
I do wish some people working on their computers would share space more so others coming in can sit and enjoy the space.
Parking can be tough on some days, but it's definitely worth it.

mint cold brew.review: YES! Rise & Grind has awesome drinks! Creme brulee latte? ummmm, Yes! Mint cold brew? It had me buzzing for hours! I've also had a couple of their snacks, which are the perfect compliment to your coffee. I do wish some people working on their computers would share space more so others coming in can sit and enjoy the space. Parking can be tough on some days, but it's definitely worth it.

excerpts: My favorite drink on their menu is the Mint Cold Brew.
I also really like their Creme Brûlée Latte as well.
mint cold brew.author: John M.
mint cold brew.review:
By far one of my most favorite coffee shops and places to chill in The City. It all starts with the owners, Vee & V. The way they take the time to get to know each every single customer who walks through their doors shows just how invested in they are. 

Their drinks and food are always made to order, it may take longer than some shops but you can taste the difference. My favorite drink on their menu is the Mint Cold Brew. I also really like their Creme Brûlée Latte as well. For food, their avocado toast is always smackin!! Fresh bread, nice avocados & delivered right to your table with knife & fork. What else could you ask for?

This trip I special ordered Waffles: half matcha with ice cream on side & half ube with extra ube on side. Let's say I was no where near disappointed. Crackin! If you're in the hood drop by & check out what they're selling because you won't leave sad. 

Oh, plenty of plugs, seating, and strong Wifi. Not to mention Cori the Corgi

mint cold brew.review: Came across this place and was so excited to try it. Very disappointed. My boyfriend and I ordered the matcha waffle, the girl got our order wrong and gave us a snooty attitude saying she "heard Belgian." The waffle was ok, gave us very little syrup so it was a bit dry. We got the mint cold brew which was good, not too minty but still had a hint. The service was very upsetting we got such snooty vibes from all of them. Prices are ok. We will not be going back.

excerpts: I've only had the americano and the mint cold brew so far
but I'll definitely be back!
Super yummy toasts and their pastries looked great.
Extremely friendly staff.
You won't regret coming here!
mint cold brew.author: Kylee P.
mint cold brew.review: SF is full of great coffee shops and this one is no exception. It's a great place to study/work and get a really delicious drink. I've only had the americano and the mint cold brew so far but I'll definitely be back! Super yummy toasts and their pastries looked great. Extremely friendly staff. You won't regret coming here!

excerpts: Will definitely by coming back to try their mint cold brew...
mint cold brew.author: Megan W.
mint cold brew.review: The Whopper Latte here started my Saturday off great! The Belgian waffle was fluffy and complemented it perfectly. Friendly staff, local art, handmade benches- all the elements of a great cafe! Will definitely by coming back to try their mint cold brew...

excerpts:
($7ish)

Salted caramel latte:
salted caramel latte.author: Yuan Z.
salted caramel latte.review:
Shop: Super cute! There are seatings but you may have to share the tables with others. There are a couple spots for electric outlets, which is a plus! 

Bathroom: Get a code from the cashier. It's clean! 

Staff: Super nice and friendly. The orders were made pretty quickly as well. 

Avocado toast: The best one I've ever had. The avocado is mushed, well seasoned, and nicely spread. The toast was crunchy on the sides and soft on the inside. ($9ish)

Breakfast something Sandwich: The aioli sauce on it gave the sandwich a great taste. Everything was just a perfect combination with the buns, the cheese, the egg and the bacon. ($7ish)

Salted caramel latte: Tasted amazing. ($4-$5)

Cold brew: They didn't cold brew it right then and there. It was in a jug which was in the fridge. However, it actually still tasted great. ($4-$5)

WiFi password can be requested. 

I would totally come back. This is my new favorite coffee shop to get work done and fill my belly!

excerpts: Salted Caramel Latte - A solid caramel latte.
salted caramel latte.author: Amy T.
salted caramel latte.review:
Loved my experience at this trendy coffee shop tucked away on this residential block right off Park Presidio.

London Fog - this is one of the better Earl Grey lattes that I've had! The milk supports the Early Grey tea very well, the tea still comes through strong. 

Avocado Toast - Runny, fried egg sits atop of a bed of mashed avocado smeared across a comfy, thick piece of toast. Garnished with red pepper flakes. Yum! 

Salted Caramel Latte - A solid caramel latte. The latte art was definitely a plus!

Matcha Waffles - MMmmatcha! Comes in 4 pieces, toasted and drizzled over by a matcha/condensed milk syrup. The edges were a little overdone but I loved this nonetheless! Especially the sauce.

Their menu definitely stands out, at least this is the first time I have ever seen Whopper Latte on a menu. Whether you are in a hurry and want to call in your order for a quick pick up or take your time sitting in to enjoy your matcha waffle and latte art, this is the place.

excerpts: My favorites are the salted caramel latte and biscoff latte.
They're both subtly sweet.
Nice little joint to study
and they're super dog friendly!
(They also have treats for your furry loved ones)
salted caramel latte.author: Betty T.
salted caramel latte.review: Love this place. I come here at least once a week. My favorites are the salted caramel latte and biscoff latte. They're both subtly sweet. Nice little joint to study and they're super dog friendly! (They also have treats for your furry loved ones)

excerpts: AMAZING salted caramel latte!
Not too sweet with a great taste.
And the latte was the perfect temperature.
Hit but not so much so that you couldn't enjoy right away.
If I lived here I'd go back all the time.
salted caramel latte.author: Shannon F.
salted caramel latte.review: Needed an afternoon pick-me-up and stumbled upon this place. Minimal look with local artists' work on the walls. Friendly staff and the best coffee I've had in quite some time. AMAZING salted caramel latte! Not too sweet with a great taste. And the latte was the perfect temperature. Hit but not so much so that you couldn't enjoy right away. If I lived here I'd go back all the time.
