excerpts: Whopper Latte - I didn't get too much of a malted chocolate flavor aside from some whopper bits on top, but I was pleasantly surprised that the latte was not jaw-achingly sweet.
Kudos to them for not going overkill on sugar like many other places do.
whopper latte.author: Sheila C.
whopper latte.review:
Featured creative lattes like Whopper, Creme Brulee, and Peanut Butter along with trendy bites like avocado toast, corn toast, ube or matcha waffles, and chia pudding, this is a one-stop shop for your caffeine fix AND tasty eats. 

Ube Waffle - Recommended!  Beautiful presentation with vibrant purple ube colors mixed with a dusting of powdered sugar.  The waffles were pleasantly fluffy and soft in the center with crisp edges.

Chia Pudding - Feeling healthy?  Go for the chia pudding topped with fresh blueberries and cinnamon.  Or do what I did and go halfsies on waffles / chia pudding to splurge a little and be conscientious.

Whopper Latte - I didn't get too much of a malted chocolate flavor aside from some whopper bits on top, but I was pleasantly surprised that the latte was not jaw-achingly sweet.  Kudos to them for not going overkill on sugar like many other places do.

excerpts: I got their Whopper Latte.
This is not to be confused with a Burger King Whopper lol, but rather Whopper Malted Milk Chocolate candies.
Even though it was a latte, it was pretty chocolatey which I loved.
The froth was nice and thick, pretty nice considering it was almond milk.
Well done!
whopper latte.author: Jocelyn L.
whopper latte.review:
My friend was basically begging me to come here to give this place a chance. He comes here religiously once a week, and has even become good friends with the owner! It has flawless reviews and is pretty close to my home. So finally, I gave it a chance!

I got their Whopper Latte. This is not to be confused with a Burger King Whopper lol, but rather Whopper Malted Milk Chocolate candies. Even though it was a latte, it was pretty chocolatey which I loved. The froth was nice and thick, pretty nice considering it was almond milk. Well done! Not too sweet, just in case you were wondering.

I was really hoping for one of their animated lattes (they have a special latte artist!) but she only comes in the afternoons FYI. Next time I'll catch her! They also have a cute Corgi named Cori who I have not met yet unfortunately. Apparently he's super friendly and runs & runs around the place. Looking forward to my next visit! 

Staff is super friendly and sweet. For my friend who is a regular, they give him free coffee. One time he took a nap, and he woke up to find on the house snacks waiting for him at his table! Wow. Now that is service!

This is also a great place to grab a coffee before starting your day in Golden Gate Park! It's right near one of the entrances.

excerpts: I ordered the whopper latte
and I'd give it 4/5.
The latte wasn't overly sweet and I could taste the malt, which is nice.
Second purchase was the breakfast bun sandwich and I'd give it a 1/5.
I couldn't eat it as it was drenched in thousand island sauce or drenched with whatever sauce is included, which is overly sweet (see photo).
I returned it and asked if they could make it with no sauce.
The sand which without the sauce is okay.
Nothing amazing
whopper latte.author: Phoebe U.
whopper latte.review:
Came here on Friday morning and was second in line.
 I ordered the whopper latte and I'd give it 4/5. The latte wasn't overly sweet and I could taste the malt, which is nice. 
Second purchase was the breakfast bun sandwich and I'd give it a 1/5. I couldn't eat it as it was drenched in thousand island sauce or drenched with whatever sauce is included, which is overly sweet (see photo). I returned it and asked if they could make it with no sauce. The sand which without the sauce is okay. Nothing amazing but it does the trick if you're hungry. 

Not sure if the photo does it justice, but the sauce was on the top bun, spilling out the sides, and coating the bottom bun. I tried to scrape some off before I ate too.

excerpts: I had the whopper latte which was sweet and dense.
whopper latte.author: Peter T.
whopper latte.review:
Came up from San Diego to help some friends with their engagement (Nikki and Jim). They've been raving about rise and grind, highlighting the friendliness of the owners and the ambiance. 

Rise and Grind is exceptional on every mark. The owners were indeed super friendly, the food was great, the coffee was unique. Portions are generous . 

The avocado toast was a big highlight. Large thick toast with creamy avocado and a soft boiled egg.

They have rotating specialty coffees. I had the whopper latte which was sweet and dense.

Rise and Grind is an unpretentious lovely neighborhood coffee spot. Highly recommend.

excerpts: My favorite item is the Whopper Latte.
It's not super sweet as I expected it would be, but I definitely got a genuine light malty taste.
It was pleasantly enjoyable!
whopper latte.author: Brittney H.
whopper latte.review:
A super cute coffee shop to visit before your big day plans in the Golden Gate Park. The staff is super friendly and will happily explain each of their menu items to you. Ambiance is chill, as a great place to work on your computer. Not necessarily a comfy place to kick back and read a book. Nice large windows provide natural light and there's also a lot of local art for purchase on the walls. 

My favorite item is the Whopper Latte. It's not super sweet as I expected it would be, but I definitely got a genuine light malty taste. It was pleasantly enjoyable!

excerpts: If you're a fan of mochas, do yourself a flavor and get the Whopper Latte.
The heat from the steamed milk softens the Whopper ball crumbles and it's pleasant.
Sweet but not too sweet, strong, flavorful, bomb!
whopper latte.author: Michelle D.
whopper latte.review: I've been contemplating for awhile about Rise&Grind. You know that place we call "Home" that's also in SF? If you can't find a drink at Home, which I cannot - start your "I need something to wake me up" morning or anytime of the day with Rise&Grind. I'm talking about creative drinks you can actually taste the espresso, not flavored milk (ahem* Home). If you're a fan of mochas, do yourself a flavor and get the Whopper Latte. The heat from the steamed milk softens the Whopper ball crumbles and it's pleasant. Sweet but not too sweet, strong, flavorful, bomb!

excerpts: I tried the whopper latte
and it was delicious!
I will definitely be back to try their pour-over brews and pastries.
whopper latte.author: Katie P.
whopper latte.review: Love this little coffee shop next to Golden Gate Park! Their staff is super friendly and greets you when entering the door. I tried the whopper latte and it was delicious! I will definitely be back to try their pour-over brews and pastries.

excerpts: I had the Iced Whopper Latte and donut muffin!
It was heaven!!
Definitely would recommend.
And it wasn't crowded at all on a Saturday morning which is a HUGE
plus!!
whopper latte.author: Krystyna P.
whopper latte.review: Amazing!! I had the Iced Whopper Latte and donut muffin! It was heaven!! Definitely would recommend. And it wasn't crowded at all on a Saturday morning which is a HUGE plus!!

excerpts: We al ordered coffee from the specials menu, including a creme brûlée latte, salted caramel late, and a whopper latte.
All the drinks were delicious and served adorably.
Glad we came in, definitely worth it.
whopper latte.author: Anum A.
whopper latte.review: This is a cute little coffee shop right outside of Golden Gate Park. My friends and I came in here because we had some time to kill before dinner and thought we could use a cup of coffee. As we stepped in we noticed the clean eclectic look, and the walls dotted with art for sale- assuming these are local artists. Anywho there were two people behind the counter and both were equally friendly. They helped us order and they talked to me about a lot of local sushi spots since they overheard that's what we were having for dinner. The two were very pleasant and helpful. We al ordered coffee from the specials menu, including a creme brûlée latte, salted caramel late, and a whopper latte. All the drinks were delicious and served adorably. Glad we came in, definitely worth it.

excerpts: They have super creative drinks like the whopper latte that's delicious and it isn't made too sweet.
whopper latte.author: Kristy M.
whopper latte.review: This plc has become a regular weekly coffee spot for me and I don't even live in the Richmond. They have super creative drinks like the whopper latte that's delicious and it isn't made too sweet. I also like their take on avocado toast.

excerpts: Especially the whopper latte!
The staff are very nice, a couple times coming in
and they'll know your name.
The place is very cozy and the perfect spot to study.
Also, if you're a dog lover so many dogs come in.
Rise and grind is definitely a place to try.
whopper latte.author: Scarlett M.
whopper latte.review: I love this place. The coffee is delicious and unique. Especially the whopper latte! The staff are very nice, a couple times coming in and they'll know your name. The place is very cozy and the perfect spot to study. Also, if you're a dog lover so many dogs come in. Rise and grind is definitely a place to try.

excerpts: The Whopper Latte here started my Saturday off great!
The Belgian waffle was fluffy and complemented it perfectly.
Friendly staff, local art, handmade benches- all the elements of a great cafe!
whopper latte.author: Megan W.
whopper latte.review: The Whopper Latte here started my Saturday off great! The Belgian waffle was fluffy and complemented it perfectly. Friendly staff, local art, handmade benches- all the elements of a great cafe! Will definitely by coming back to try their mint cold brew...

excerpts: Peanut Butter Latte and Mint Cold Brew.
The big, beautifully golden brown crispy disks of Chocolate Chip Cookie in their case also looked really tempting
Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte.
I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together
but there is sorcery in this
and it totally works.
Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte.
I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together
but there is sorcery in this
and it totally works.
peanut butter latte.author: Sarah J.
peanut butter latte.review:
I stopped in Rise & Grind today after chilling out over at Lands End. I decided to go with 2 unusual drinks because why not? Today was grey and misty and required extra caffeine in unusual flavors: Peanut Butter Latte and Mint Cold Brew. The big, beautifully golden brown crispy disks of Chocolate Chip Cookie in their case also looked really tempting but I stuck to liquids today.

Both drinks are tasty but imho, the Mint Cold Brew edges out the PB Latte. I never thought mint and coffee would taste good together but there is sorcery in this and it totally works. Refreshing yet invigorating ;-) 

The staff are super friendly, thank you! Great service always appreciated!

There are a few of those annoying hover-and-fly-in-eye-level-circles flies that seem to haunt San Francisco entryways, but I think those petty pests would linger inside a hospital lobby too. What is their deal?! Maybe some fly paper hidden off to the side would entrap them... I can dream. 

Bonus Points: A few loaded bookshelves inset high up on a wall -- and lots of community artwork. Cool! But did I miss a ladder or how do you get a book? You'd have to be a Shaq O'Neal to reach them if you stood on a chair. But maybe I needed more caffeine to accurately judge book-hopping. Or they are decorative books. I can dig it.

Coffee & mint. Check it out! Peace, dudes and dudettes.

excerpts: As for drinks, we tried the peanut butter latte, creme brûlée latte, and the cookie butter latte.
They all had a subtle taste of flavor which was delicious and just how I like it!
Will definitely be coming back here to try more things!
peanut butter latte.author: Monica-Leah A.
peanut butter latte.review: Absolutely looove this cafe! Such a cute spot to grab some coffee and a bite to eat. Came here with a friend in the search for a good cup of coffee. For food, we couldn't help but try the pesto toast and the Belgium waffle. Both were cooked to perfection, soo delicious!! As for drinks, we tried the peanut butter latte, creme brûlée latte, and the cookie butter latte. They all had a subtle taste of flavor which was delicious and just how I like it! Will definitely be coming back here to try more things!

excerpts: When I saw they had a creme brûlée latte AND a peanut butter latte, I knew I had to try this place out.
peanut butter latte.author: Shayne C.
peanut butter latte.review:
Made a pit stop here mid-way through our adventure filled day for some coffee and corgi loving

When I saw they had a creme brûlée latte AND a peanut butter latte, I knew I had to try this place out. 

The creme brûlée latte was pretty cool, but taste wise, nothing special. It's one of those things I'm glad I tried, but would never get again. It's just straight sugar on a latte... and the latee itself wasn't exceptional either.

I went with my mom, who is not a coffee drinker, but recommended she try the London Fog which she really enjoyed! 

Honestly, for me, the best part was the dog. His name is CORI, THE CORGI. It doesn't get better than that.

excerpts: If you want to try something different go for the peanut butter latte.
It's a friendly, casual place, but don't expect that you'll definitely get a seat, it's small.
peanut butter latte.author: Holly M.
peanut butter latte.review: This is a really cute coffee shop in the inner richmond. If you want to try something different go for the peanut butter latte. It's a friendly, casual place, but don't expect that you'll definitely get a seat, it's small.

excerpts: Peanut butter latte & the Belgian waffle are to die for!!
I liked that the cafe is spacious and doesn't feel like everyone is on top of each other.
Great atmosphere and service, and love the corgi puppy
peanut butter latte.author: Lindsey B.
peanut butter latte.review: Peanut butter latte & the Belgian waffle are to die for!! I liked that the cafe is spacious and doesn't feel like everyone is on top of each other. Great atmosphere and service, and love the corgi puppy :)

excerpts: Can't wait to try the peanut butter latte.
The pastries from Devil's Teeth are exquisite.
So happy they opened in my neighborhood and
I look forward to going there all the time!
peanut butter latte.author: J T.
peanut butter latte.review: This place is the best! The owners V and Vashelle are super nice and attentive.  The mint iced cold brew is my favorite.  Can't wait to try the peanut butter latte.  The pastries from Devil's Teeth are exquisite.  So happy they opened in my neighborhood and I look forward to going there all the time!

excerpts: Pour overs aren't bad, I wasn't too big on their Organic Seven Bridges Blend, but the Colombia they had on hand was really good (light roast: sweet lime, red grape, and cashew butter).
organic seven bridges blend.author: Aaron C.
organic seven bridges blend.review:
This place is a cozy lil cafe in the Inner Richmond, super close to Golden Gate park (situated on 8th and Fulton). 

The Frittata Sandwich is pretty dope; messy, but delicious. Pour overs aren't bad, I wasn't too big on their Organic Seven Bridges Blend, but the Colombia they had on hand was really good (light roast: sweet lime, red grape, and cashew butter). 

They have some cool art pieces with cute lil Dr. Seuss quotes laminated into the floors. Wish nothing but the best to this cafe, seeing as how the cafe competition in SF is brutal.

excerpts: Pour overs aren't bad, I wasn't too big on their Organic Seven Bridges Blend, but the Colombia they had on hand was really good (light roast: sweet lime, red grape, and cashew butter).
colombia.author: Aaron C.
colombia.review:
This place is a cozy lil cafe in the Inner Richmond, super close to Golden Gate park (situated on 8th and Fulton). 

The Frittata Sandwich is pretty dope; messy, but delicious. Pour overs aren't bad, I wasn't too big on their Organic Seven Bridges Blend, but the Colombia they had on hand was really good (light roast: sweet lime, red grape, and cashew butter). 

They have some cool art pieces with cute lil Dr. Seuss quotes laminated into the floors. Wish nothing but the best to this cafe, seeing as how the cafe competition in SF is brutal.

excerpts: Rise & Grind makes a creme brulee latte and a special's menu Biscoff cookie butter latte that are decadent and delicious.
biscoff cookie butter latte.author: Deanna Y.
biscoff cookie butter latte.review:
Coffee and corgis are a few of my favorite things. Starting the day off with both of these? Total win. After a few visits, Rise & Grind has become one of my favorite coffee shops...and it's not just because of Cori the corgi - promise! 

I'm a sucker for specialty lattes, especially creative ones that you can't find anywhere else. Rise & Grind makes a creme brulee latte and a special's menu Biscoff cookie butter latte that are decadent and delicious. Perfect if you have a sweet tooth like me!

Avocado toast, matcha waffles, and bacon, avocado, aioli breakfast sandwiches are amongst some of the tasty options available for your snacking needs. 

Walls adorned with art. Friendly owner and servers. Seating available for coffee-sipping conversations and laptop lounging. Food orders can take awhile, but it's usually because they get pretty busy. Solid coffee shop and a great addition to the neighborhood!

excerpts: I had the black sesame latte with soy milk and it was very light in sweetness (perfect), had that distinct black sesame taste, and a subtle hint of espresso (decaf...
I know, what's the point of decaf, right?).
Never had black sesame as a latte, but I would definitely order it from here again!
black sesame latte.author: Peds P.
black sesame latte.review:
Came here with friends for a good hipster cafe experience. Did not disappoint! 

I had the black sesame latte with soy milk and it was very light in sweetness (perfect), had that distinct black sesame taste, and a subtle hint of espresso (decaf...I know, what's the point of decaf, right?).  Never had black sesame as a latte, but I would definitely order it from here again!

excerpts: The black sesame latte was great, but had the grainy bits of real sesame so those might get stuck in your teeth!
Just a forewarning because that black sesame look is not cute.
black sesame latte.author: Rachel L.
black sesame latte.review:
I came in a group of five, but there was enough working space and plenty of outlets! The music can be a little loud by the window corners, so avoid that area if you're trying to study.

The workers were friendly and put out orders quickly even though when were a lot of people. They had unique items like creme brûlée and black sesame lattes and ube waffles. The black sesame latte was great, but had the grainy bits of real sesame so those might get stuck in your teeth! Just a forewarning because that black sesame look is not cute.

excerpts: I've tried a couple of drinks here (all of which are fantastic), but their black sesame latte is my recent FAVORITE!
Trust me, it's a game changer.
black sesame latte.author: Denise T.
black sesame latte.review:
Absolutely love this coffee spot! I've tried a couple of drinks here (all of which are fantastic), but their black sesame latte is my recent FAVORITE! Trust me, it's a game changer. I've tried both the iced and hot versions and they're both AMAZING AS F.

In addition to coffee, they offer a variety of other creative items on their menu. Their avocado toast is delicious (presentation is on point) and for those with a sweet tooth, their ube waffle is to die for! So many more items on the menu that I need to try.

The owners and staff are also super nice and friendly, and attract a lot of regulars in the neighborhood (myself included). It's a popular spot with really great ambiance to study/work -- if only this place was around back in my college days!

Highly suggest checking this place out if you haven't yet. Trust me, you won't regret it!

excerpts: Yay they have, Black Sesame Latte!
I've been looking long and hard for a good black sesame latte place in the bay area, and alas
black sesame latte.author: Tiffany T.
black sesame latte.review:
Yay they have, Black Sesame Latte!

I've been looking long and hard for a good black sesame latte place in the bay area, and alas I've found it. 

I opt for the black sesame, iced and half sweeten. I wished I got it in regular because it wasn't sweet at all and a bit watered down. 

Nonetheless it was worth trying and I'll probably come back if I were in the area to give it another shot.

excerpts: Ordered myself a biscuit breakfast sandwich and a black sesame latte.
As for my black sesame latte, I could definitely taste the roasted smokiness from the black sesame
but I had to constantly swirl my latte before a sip.
Even then, the bottom had a lot of black sesame sedament.
black sesame latte.author: Elaine Y.
black sesame latte.review:
Ordered myself a biscuit breakfast sandwich and a black sesame latte. 

The biscuit breakfast sandwich is definitely a winner. Delivered warmed, the biscuit was fluffy and not too dense. It comes with some thinly sliced avocado, cheese, thick sliced bacon, and a sliced hard boiled egg. Everything is then tied together with a delicious aioli. 

As for my black sesame latte, I could definitely taste the roasted smokiness from the black sesame but I had to constantly swirl my latte before a sip. Even then, the bottom had a lot of black sesame sedament. Maybe, I'll try a variety that combines more easily next time - looking right at you, biscoff latte...

Overall, both were very good, but I was a bit disappointed that they were delivered so far apart. Coffee was definitely getting cold by the time my sandwich was brought over.

excerpts: 4 stars for the place/staff, 2 stars for the black sesame latte that had lumps while I drank it and a thick sludge at the bottom of the cup.
Shop is bright with lots of windows and plentiful seating for a smallish place.
Staff are friendly!
I rarely get a specialty coffee but was tempted because they had so many unusual ones.
Sounded better than it was--thankfully though, it wasn't too sweet.
Not sure if a regular latte would be up to par...
black sesame latte.author: CityPixie Q.
black sesame latte.review: 4 stars for the place/staff, 2 stars for the black sesame latte that had lumps while I drank it and a thick sludge at the bottom of the cup. Shop is bright with lots of windows and plentiful seating for a smallish place. Staff are friendly! I rarely get a specialty coffee but was tempted because they had so many unusual ones. Sounded better than it was--thankfully though, it wasn't too sweet. Not sure if a regular latte would be up to par...

excerpts: I also ordered the Black sesame latte, which was pretty good.
Not overly sweet, only issue
I was bothered with
was that there was a layer of sesame on the bottom that didn't seem to have mixed well with the rest of the drink.
black sesame latte.author: Karen L.
black sesame latte.review:
The Avocado toast is simply delicious, even though it's pricey.  It is just a piece of toast with avocado spread all over sprinkled with some chili flakes and a soft boiled egg.  But it was so good.  I was just a tad disappointed my egg didn't leak like the pictures people have been posting.  

Not a big fan of the Ube waffle I had especially came for.  The waffle was a bit dry and a bit plain, even though there's a side of ube paste with it.

I also ordered the Black sesame latte, which was pretty good.  Not overly sweet, only issue I was bothered with was that there was a layer of sesame on the bottom that didn't seem to have mixed well with the rest of the drink.

excerpts: The black sesame latte and creme Brûlée latte was delicious!
black sesame latte.author: Kwiri Y.
black sesame latte.review:
5 out of 5 stars on yelp was not a disappointment. 

Small cafe with lot of people studying in the cafe. Not a typical brunch hangout joint despite all the amazing latte art and delicious food photos on yelp and Instagram, so make sure to set your expectations. 

I went with a group of 4 people and it took a while to wait for a table to open even though it was a rainy day with no wait. 

All the staff are all incredibly accommodating and thoughtful. Amazing service and pride to their food and drinks. One of the most interesting and delicious cafe experience I've had and was totally worth tracking out little far from the city to try it out. 

The black sesame latte and creme Brûlée latte was delicious! Matcha waffle and avocado toast is fresh and perfectly portioned and cooked. 

Street parking and dog friendly cafe.

excerpts: The Matcha waffle and the black sesame latte were delicious.
The waffle (6.25 not bad) wasn't too sweet and with just the right amount of syrup so that it wasn't to dry.
The taste of matcha was just right as well.
black sesame latte.author: Jennifer H.
black sesame latte.review:
The Matcha waffle and the black sesame latte were delicious. The waffle (6.25 not bad) wasn't too sweet and with just the right amount of syrup so that it wasn't to dry. The taste of matcha was just right as well. Gotta try the Ube waffle next time! 

Everyone was super friendly, and there was a decent amount of space making it a great spot to work as well!

excerpts: The black sesame latte, however, was very disappointing.
My friend and I were excited to see black sesame latte on their special menu, so we both ordered it.
black sesame latte.author: Marti L.
black sesame latte.review:
I really enjoyed their avocado and egg toast! The egg was perfectly soft boiled. The combo of avocado and chili flakes was delicious.

The black sesame latte, however, was very disappointing. My friend and I were excited to see black sesame latte on their special menu, so we both ordered it. Unfortunately,  that meant double the disappointment.

1. No latte art - after seeing other ppl's drinks, our lattes came out with nada.
2. Lukewarm drink - my latte had steam coming out, but my friend's latte was not hot at all.
3. Minimal black sesame taste - we could barely taste the black sesame and there were clumps of black sesame goop at the bottom of our drinks.

I'm not sure if I would come back.

excerpts: Nice selection of espresso drinks (black sesame latte - yum!) and breakfast options.
black sesame latte.author: Annie R.
black sesame latte.review: Neighborhood gem of a coffee shop.  Great service, atmosphere.  Nice selection of espresso drinks (black sesame latte - yum!) and breakfast options.  I had the organic matcha waffle, which was worth trying but slightly over-saturated with matcha powder.  I hope this place sticks around.  I enjoy coming here on the weekends on my way to GG park.

excerpts: Love this place - def try the black sesame latte and waffles!!
Friendly staff and cute atmosphere.
black sesame latte.author: Janet C.
black sesame latte.review: Love this place - def try the black sesame latte and waffles!! Friendly staff and cute atmosphere.

excerpts: My black sesame latte lacked flavor, the coffee was a bit sour, the matcha waffle didn't impress my son at all.
black sesame latte.author: S L.
black sesame latte.review: Cute little place good for some casual reading time but the drinks and food items were a bit underwhelming. My black sesame latte lacked flavor, the coffee was a bit sour, the matcha waffle didn't impress my son at all. The avocado toast was okay. Too bad. I am always on the hunt for good local options but this one definitely did not stand up to the 4.5 stars on yelp.

excerpts: The black sesame latte and the cookie butter latte are my favorites.
black sesame latte.author: Brendon L.
black sesame latte.review: To say I've been here a few times is an understatement. The staff is always warm and welcoming. The black sesame latte and the cookie butter latte are my favorites. The corn toast is my favorite food item and my friends love the avocado toast. Great spot to study, do a little work, catch up with friends, and people watch. Check them out!

excerpts: Avocado toast:
The best one I've ever had.
The avocado is mushed, well seasoned, and nicely spread.
The toast was crunchy on the sides and soft on the inside.
avocado toast.author: Yuan Z.
avocado toast.review:
Shop: Super cute! There are seatings but you may have to share the tables with others. There are a couple spots for electric outlets, which is a plus! 

Bathroom: Get a code from the cashier. It's clean! 

Staff: Super nice and friendly. The orders were made pretty quickly as well. 

Avocado toast: The best one I've ever had. The avocado is mushed, well seasoned, and nicely spread. The toast was crunchy on the sides and soft on the inside. ($9ish)

Breakfast something Sandwich: The aioli sauce on it gave the sandwich a great taste. Everything was just a perfect combination with the buns, the cheese, the egg and the bacon. ($7ish)

Salted caramel latte: Tasted amazing. ($4-$5)

Cold brew: They didn't cold brew it right then and there. It was in a jug which was in the fridge. However, it actually still tasted great. ($4-$5)

WiFi password can be requested. 

I would totally come back. This is my new favorite coffee shop to get work done and fill my belly!

excerpts: Avocado Toast - Runny, fried egg sits atop of a bed of mashed avocado smeared across a comfy, thick piece of toast.
Garnished with red pepper flakes.
avocado toast.author: Amy T.
avocado toast.review:
Loved my experience at this trendy coffee shop tucked away on this residential block right off Park Presidio.

London Fog - this is one of the better Earl Grey lattes that I've had! The milk supports the Early Grey tea very well, the tea still comes through strong. 

Avocado Toast - Runny, fried egg sits atop of a bed of mashed avocado smeared across a comfy, thick piece of toast. Garnished with red pepper flakes. Yum! 

Salted Caramel Latte - A solid caramel latte. The latte art was definitely a plus!

Matcha Waffles - MMmmatcha! Comes in 4 pieces, toasted and drizzled over by a matcha/condensed milk syrup. The edges were a little overdone but I loved this nonetheless! Especially the sauce.

Their menu definitely stands out, at least this is the first time I have ever seen Whopper Latte on a menu. Whether you are in a hurry and want to call in your order for a quick pick up or take your time sitting in to enjoy your matcha waffle and latte art, this is the place.

excerpts: Avocado toast ($9.25) -
I really really love avocado toast
but I can't justify the price of this!
Almost $10 for a thick piece of toast, soft boiled egg, and chili flakes.
Although this was delicious, it's definitely overpriced compared to other places where I paid around $7 for the same thing.
avocado toast.author: Cecille W.
avocado toast.review:
Cute and busy neighborhood coffee shop with a variety of food! 

Mint Cold Brew ($5) - Kind of tastes like the mint mojito coffee at Philz, but with homemade mint syrup! Minty, smooth, and strong! A great iced coffee. 

Vanilla Latte with soy ($4) - +$0.60 for soy. Light and creamy latte with a good amount of foam and vanilla flavor. Not too sweet. Loved this although I wish I ventured out and tried one of their specialty lattes! 

Pesto Toast ($6.75) - Thick (but soft) toast with melted cheese, tomatoes, and slices of pepperoni. Loooved this, and reasonably priced. 

Breakfast bunwich Sandwich ($7.50) - Pretty decent sandwich, with bacon, boiled egg, avocado, and thousand island dressing, but I would say it's a little overpriced for the size of it. Comes warm wrapped in foil. 

Avocado toast ($9.25) - I really really love avocado toast but I can't justify the price of this! Almost $10 for a thick piece of toast, soft boiled egg, and chili flakes. Although this was delicious, it's definitely overpriced compared to other places where I paid around $7 for the same thing. You can choose either a fried egg or soft boiled. 

For two people our total was $33, which we thought was a bit expensive for everything but we enjoyed our breakfast nonetheless. Very cute interior with a good amount of tables and seating. Definitely want to try the matcha waffles and specialty lattes next time!

excerpts: Their avocado toast is delicious (presentation is on point) and for those with a sweet tooth, their ube waffle is to die for!
avocado toast.author: Denise T.
avocado toast.review:
Absolutely love this coffee spot! I've tried a couple of drinks here (all of which are fantastic), but their black sesame latte is my recent FAVORITE! Trust me, it's a game changer. I've tried both the iced and hot versions and they're both AMAZING AS F.

In addition to coffee, they offer a variety of other creative items on their menu. Their avocado toast is delicious (presentation is on point) and for those with a sweet tooth, their ube waffle is to die for! So many more items on the menu that I need to try.

The owners and staff are also super nice and friendly, and attract a lot of regulars in the neighborhood (myself included). It's a popular spot with really great ambiance to study/work -- if only this place was around back in my college days!

Highly suggest checking this place out if you haven't yet. Trust me, you won't regret it!

excerpts: Featured creative lattes like Whopper, Creme Brulee, and Peanut Butter along with trendy bites like avocado toast, corn toast, ube or matcha waffles, and chia pudding
avocado toast.author: Sheila C.
avocado toast.review:
Featured creative lattes like Whopper, Creme Brulee, and Peanut Butter along with trendy bites like avocado toast, corn toast, ube or matcha waffles, and chia pudding, this is a one-stop shop for your caffeine fix AND tasty eats. 

Ube Waffle - Recommended!  Beautiful presentation with vibrant purple ube colors mixed with a dusting of powdered sugar.  The waffles were pleasantly fluffy and soft in the center with crisp edges.

Chia Pudding - Feeling healthy?  Go for the chia pudding topped with fresh blueberries and cinnamon.  Or do what I did and go halfsies on waffles / chia pudding to splurge a little and be conscientious.

Whopper Latte - I didn't get too much of a malted chocolate flavor aside from some whopper bits on top, but I was pleasantly surprised that the latte was not jaw-achingly sweet.  Kudos to them for not going overkill on sugar like many other places do.

excerpts: However, I will say their avocado toast is very good!
You can tell they use fresh avocado and the egg they use perfectly drools out the yolk on top.
Yum!
avocado toast.author: Sarah Ann K.
avocado toast.review: Cute little cafe!! Very small so you really gotta scope out good seats if you want to study here on a weekend! My friend and I got a spot at the bar table with high chairs facing the window. It was okay, but we had a lot of stuff so it was cramped with both of our laptops and notes, as well as our food and drinks. However, I will say their avocado toast is very good! You can tell they use fresh avocado and the egg they use perfectly drools out the yolk on top. Yum!

excerpts: Avocado toast, matcha waffles, and bacon, avocado, aioli breakfast sandwiches are amongst some of the tasty options available for your snacking needs.
avocado toast.author: Deanna Y.
avocado toast.review:
Coffee and corgis are a few of my favorite things. Starting the day off with both of these? Total win. After a few visits, Rise & Grind has become one of my favorite coffee shops...and it's not just because of Cori the corgi - promise! 

I'm a sucker for specialty lattes, especially creative ones that you can't find anywhere else. Rise & Grind makes a creme brulee latte and a special's menu Biscoff cookie butter latte that are decadent and delicious. Perfect if you have a sweet tooth like me!

Avocado toast, matcha waffles, and bacon, avocado, aioli breakfast sandwiches are amongst some of the tasty options available for your snacking needs. 

Walls adorned with art. Friendly owner and servers. Seating available for coffee-sipping conversations and laptop lounging. Food orders can take awhile, but it's usually because they get pretty busy. Solid coffee shop and a great addition to the neighborhood!

excerpts: The avocado toast was millennial-tastic.
avocado toast.author: Whitney D.
avocado toast.review:
We stopped here three mornings in a row on our vacation. I'm a coffee snob and I found the coffee to be dang good. The food was tasty. The avocado toast was millennial-tastic. 

Best of all, the place was SO clean, the staff was SO friendly and we loved the parade of cute dogs coming in and out.

It's a little pricy, but probably standard for a big city.

excerpts: The Avocado toast is simply delicious, even though it's pricey.
It is just a piece of toast with avocado spread all over sprinkled with some chili flakes and a soft boiled egg.
But it was so good.
avocado toast.author: Karen L.
avocado toast.review:
The Avocado toast is simply delicious, even though it's pricey.  It is just a piece of toast with avocado spread all over sprinkled with some chili flakes and a soft boiled egg.  But it was so good.  I was just a tad disappointed my egg didn't leak like the pictures people have been posting.  

Not a big fan of the Ube waffle I had especially came for.  The waffle was a bit dry and a bit plain, even though there's a side of ube paste with it.

I also ordered the Black sesame latte, which was pretty good.  Not overly sweet, only issue I was bothered with was that there was a layer of sesame on the bottom that didn't seem to have mixed well with the rest of the drink.

excerpts: Matcha waffle and avocado toast is fresh and perfectly portioned and cooked.
avocado toast.author: Kwiri Y.
avocado toast.review:
5 out of 5 stars on yelp was not a disappointment. 

Small cafe with lot of people studying in the cafe. Not a typical brunch hangout joint despite all the amazing latte art and delicious food photos on yelp and Instagram, so make sure to set your expectations. 

I went with a group of 4 people and it took a while to wait for a table to open even though it was a rainy day with no wait. 

All the staff are all incredibly accommodating and thoughtful. Amazing service and pride to their food and drinks. One of the most interesting and delicious cafe experience I've had and was totally worth tracking out little far from the city to try it out. 

The black sesame latte and creme Brûlée latte was delicious! Matcha waffle and avocado toast is fresh and perfectly portioned and cooked. 

Street parking and dog friendly cafe.

excerpts: their Avocado Toast made on a single thick slice of bread.
One of my favorite things to have anytime of the day.
This time I ordered one with an extra soft-boiled egg & asked for NO chili flakes.
I don't like chili flakes at all.
Although it was delicious I had to scrape off the chili flakes when it was brought to my table.
They forgot :-( ...
luckily I can stand only just a little bit of heat, but next time I will have to return it if they forget again, I just hate wasting food.
avocado toast.author: Emy B.
avocado toast.review: Love this place.  Super friendly & love that I can chill inside, eat & drink a yummy latte happily by the window.  I really like their Avocado Toast made on a single thick slice of bread.  One of my favorite things to have anytime of the day.  This time I ordered one with an extra soft-boiled egg & asked for NO chili flakes.  I don't like chili flakes at all.  Although it was delicious I had to scrape off the chili flakes when it was brought to my table. They forgot :-( ... luckily I can stand only just a little bit of heat, but next time I will have to return it if they forget again, I just hate wasting food.

excerpts: The avocado toast was a big highlight.
avocado toast.author: Peter T.
avocado toast.review:
Came up from San Diego to help some friends with their engagement (Nikki and Jim). They've been raving about rise and grind, highlighting the friendliness of the owners and the ambiance. 

Rise and Grind is exceptional on every mark. The owners were indeed super friendly, the food was great, the coffee was unique. Portions are generous . 

The avocado toast was a big highlight. Large thick toast with creamy avocado and a soft boiled egg.

They have rotating specialty coffees. I had the whopper latte which was sweet and dense.

Rise and Grind is an unpretentious lovely neighborhood coffee spot. Highly recommend.

excerpts: The avocado toast seems to be a popular item as well, although I haven't tried it.
avocado toast.author: KC W.
avocado toast.review:
My new favorite study spot!! I usually never drink coffee because it tends to just put me to sleep (yes I'm weird, I know) but I actually feel caffeinated with their drinks. I highly recommend the mint cold brew, which has a nice subtle mint flavor and isn't bitter like regular black coffee. The creme brûlée latte is delicious as well - not overly sweet, and they even torch the drink just like regular creme brûlée. 

They also have toasts and pastries not displayed on the menu above the register. I've only tried the pesto toast, and while it was a little pricey at $6.50, it was very tasty. I liked that the pesto wasn't incredibly oily and that the tomatoes and pepperoni were evenly distributed throughout, and I loved how the crispy crust contrasted with the fluffy inside of the bread. The avocado toast seems to be a popular item as well, although I haven't tried it. Food can be a little slow to come out, but they're very accommodating of any special requests. 

The atmosphere of this coffeeshop definitely bumps up my rating to five stars. The owners are both super friendly and welcoming as soon as customers walk in the door, and the decorations are so unique. I especially like the signs in the restroom and randomly misspelled words hanging on the walls LOL. However, the absolute best part is Cory, the owners' pet corgi!! He's social and very distracting when I'm trying to get work done, but also incredibly well behaved. There's not a whole lot of seating but it's spacious enough for people to do work, and they have a bunch of power strips lining the walls too.

Bottom line: strong coffee, delicious food, cute puppy!

excerpts: I had their avocado toast with a perfectly poached egg -- MUST TRY.
avocado toast.author: Kristal D.
avocado toast.review:
Rise & Grind lives up to its name! They go above and beyond with what they offer. 

This place will make you feel warm and fuzzy inside! It's a cute local spot that is cozy and perfect for relaxing, people watching, or studying (they have wifi). Be sure to come early because the place is a bit small and it can fill up quick! Their ambiance is simple, yet playful and warm with Dr. Seuss quotes.

The staff and owners are also chill and friendly. You can tell that the owners love what they do. They have a great selection of items for coffee, toasts (avocado, corn/bacon, pesto), and waffles (belgian, matcha, ube). I had their avocado toast with a perfectly poached egg -- MUST TRY. 

Rise & Grind is one of those gems where you hope no one else finds so you can keep it all to yourself. At the same time, you can't help but rave about it!

excerpts: Only feedback was the avocado toast was salty; let the customer determine the amount of salt.
avocado toast.author: Missy G.
avocado toast.review: Friendly staff, quick service, very foamy mocha. Nice they offer two different non dairy milk options. Clean quaint place. Only feedback was the avocado toast was salty; let the customer determine the amount of salt.

excerpts: For food, their avocado toast is always smackin!!
Fresh bread, nice avocados & delivered right to your table with knife & fork.
avocado toast.author: John M.
avocado toast.review:
By far one of my most favorite coffee shops and places to chill in The City. It all starts with the owners, Vee & V. The way they take the time to get to know each every single customer who walks through their doors shows just how invested in they are. 

Their drinks and food are always made to order, it may take longer than some shops but you can taste the difference. My favorite drink on their menu is the Mint Cold Brew. I also really like their Creme Brûlée Latte as well. For food, their avocado toast is always smackin!! Fresh bread, nice avocados & delivered right to your table with knife & fork. What else could you ask for?

This trip I special ordered Waffles: half matcha with ice cream on side & half ube with extra ube on side. Let's say I was no where near disappointed. Crackin! If you're in the hood drop by & check out what they're selling because you won't leave sad. 

Oh, plenty of plugs, seating, and strong Wifi. Not to mention Cori the Corgi

excerpts: They also sell avocado toast here which is a popular trend in SF...but if I could suggest anything to any friend is to make your own toast at home!
It will save you cash that you could be spending towards coffee (=
avocado toast.author: Mary L.
avocado toast.review:
I pass by this cafe all the time on my way to ggp and decided to stop by one day with a friend of mine. Its right by the 44 bus stop so it is such a great spot to meet up with someone, or wait for your bus! There aren't too many tables so I can't say whether or not this will be a good study spot. However, there is a lot of light that shines in through the windows which is a major PLUS in my book. 

They also sell avocado toast here which is a popular trend in SF...but if I could suggest anything to any friend is to make your own toast at home! It will save you cash that you could be spending towards coffee (= think about it!!

This rating is mainly based on the ENVIRONMENT and ATMOSPHERE. I will have to be back to try their drinks!

excerpts: My favorites are the avocado toast and the PB&J toast.
One order of toast is very filling in my opinion but sometimes if I'm really hungry, I'll order both.
Haha.
For drinks, the iced ginger peach tea is my favorite.
I try to be healthy for the most part but man their cookie butter latte is hard to resist sometimes as well.
Other than that, the owners are the friendliest people, which is what keeps me coming back as much as the food.
Lots of love for this place!
avocado toast.author: Ashley M.
avocado toast.review:
This is not your pretentious coffee shop, which honestly, after living here my whole life, I'm tired of seeing in this city. This place has more of an authentic, neighborhood feel. 

I work nearby at USF and this is my go-to spot for lunch. My favorites are the avocado toast and the PB&J toast. One order of toast is very filling in my opinion but sometimes if I'm really hungry, I'll order both. Haha. For drinks, the iced ginger peach tea is my favorite. I try to be healthy for the most part but man their cookie butter latte is hard to resist sometimes as well. Other than that, the owners are the friendliest people, which is what keeps me coming back as much as the food. Lots of love for this place!

excerpts: I ordered the avocado toast *minus the egg* and a vanilla latte.
The toast and coffee came out at a good pace and I was happy to find that the latte was at a good, hot temperature.
Tastewise the toast was good, but nothing great.
The thing for me is, if I'm paying ~$9 for avocado toast, I expect it to be somewhat mindblowing or at least something removed from the mundane.
However, this was just bread with some avocado and some simple seasoning.
Simple is great, but I just felt like there was so much more they could have done with it.
My vanilla latte was good, but like I said before, nothing extraordinary about it.
This is a cute shop to drop by if you are in the area, but I wouldn't make it my go to destination.
avocado toast.author: Lakshmi M.
avocado toast.review: Dropped by Rise & Grind during one of my visits to Golden Gate Park. The interior is cozy and has a fair amount of seating so you can definitely come in, grab a coffee, and sit down to get some work done. I ordered the avocado toast *minus the egg* and a vanilla latte. The toast and coffee came out at a good pace and I was happy to find that the latte was at a good, hot temperature. Tastewise the toast was good, but nothing great. The thing for me is, if I'm paying ~$9 for avocado toast, I expect it to be somewhat mindblowing or at least something removed from the mundane. However, this was just bread with some avocado and some simple seasoning. Simple is great, but I just felt like there was so much more they could have done with it. My vanilla latte was good, but like I said before, nothing extraordinary about it. This is a cute shop to drop by if you are in the area, but I wouldn't make it my go to destination.

excerpts: Soft boiled eggs are a must on your avocado toast.
avocado toast.author: aaron t.
avocado toast.review: Why not get your start from a decent cafe in the area? Not much in the Richmond for good coffee. Soft boiled eggs are a must on your avocado toast.

excerpts: Their avocado toast (with a boiled egg) is amazing !
avocado toast.author: Arvind M.
avocado toast.review: Came here while waiting for a friend to finish a race in the golden gate park. Really nice place with friendly staff. Their avocado toast (with a boiled egg) is amazing !

excerpts: I had the avocado toast and soy sea salt caramel latte - both delicious!
avocado toast.author: Doreen C.
avocado toast.review:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon after seeing pictures of this place on Instagram. 
It's a super cute little coffee shop, lots of ppl at work on their laptops, cute art/decor, and for sure looks like a good place to post up and get some work done.

I had the avocado toast and soy sea salt caramel latte - both delicious! 

The toast is on a fat piece of bread - really it's quite simple, just avocado, a gooey egg, and crushed red pepper -- however, it cost almost $9. Extremely pricey for what you are getting, hence the 4 star! 

Coffee was perfect temperature and not super strong (which I prefer), no complaints there!

Staff is also super nice and friendly, always a plus!

Would come back to do work and try other unique items like the Ube waffle! Only con is the price.

excerpts: So many ingredients and it comes with potato chips, I've also had their avocado toast and the egg on top just makes it so addicting!
avocado toast.author: Briana C.
avocado toast.review:
I absolutely love this place. 

My boyfriend showed me this place because he lives around the corner and he's now a regular. 

Such a quaint space in a perfect location across from GGP and if you walk in some people are sporadically studying or just having their morning coffee. 

Coffee is always done spectacularly and the Frittata sandwich is to die for! So many ingredients and it comes with potato chips, I've also had their avocado toast and the egg on top just makes it so addicting! 

Staff is not rude and so welcoming every time you go up to the counter.

excerpts:
- Great coffee and tea
- I have an addiction to the avocado toast
And do yourself a favor and treat yourself to the Avocado Toast, you won't regret it.
avocado toast.author: James V.
avocado toast.review:
I'm a local and live extremely close to this place, and I LOVE it. I'm going to be as concise as I can get with this review:

- Great place for studying with lots of outlets, lighting, music, and mood.
- Great coffee and tea
- I have an addiction to the avocado toast - it's literally to DIE for.

The owners Vi and Vi are super-chill as well. If you need your caffeine fix and a place to study or hang out, Rise & Grind is the place. And do yourself a favor and treat yourself to the Avocado Toast, you won't regret it.

excerpts: I've tried almost all of the food items and have to put the Avocado Toast at the top of the list; a delicious thick piece of toast topped with a nice hearty spread of fresh avocado, red chili flakes, and a soft boiled egg.
It will surely leave you full for hours.
avocado toast.author: Niko L.
avocado toast.review:
Rise & Grind is without a doubt the best coffee/tea shop in the Richmond District quite possibly in San Francisco. Everything on the menu from the food to the drinks is delicious, but it's all also uniquely one of a kind. I live down the street from Rise & Grind and couldn't have been more pleased to have a local coffee spot with great food and even nicer employees open when they did a few months ago. They have a variety of specialty drinks like the creme brulee latte, cookie butter latte and their newly added Richmond chill, which is their version of Vietnamese coffee with espresso and condensed milk shaken up in a cocktail mixer. If you're not a big coffee drinker I highly recommend the London fog.

I've tried almost all of the food items and have to put the Avocado Toast at the top of the list; a delicious thick piece of toast topped with a nice hearty spread of fresh avocado, red chili flakes, and a soft boiled egg. It will surely leave you full for hours. The breakfast biscuit is another one of my favorites as well as the Pesto Toast (AMAZING), but their variety of waffles if especially delicious and one of a kind. My favorite is the Matcha waffle. Try it, you're taste buds will thank me.

Along with all the great menu items, the environment and staff are something that makes Rise & Grind especially enjoyable for me. The owners have gone out of their way to put local artists work on the walls and the business has a number of regulars you'll often see every time you go in. There's a great communal and hospitable vibe that keeps me coming back for more. To add to all the greatness of Rise & Grind, there is Cori the corgi, the resident dog who sets up camp at the spot every day and greets customers with a big smile. He's always willing to be played with and adds to the greatness of the baristas. If I could, I'd give Rise & Grind 10 stars but Yelp only lets me give 5. This is a must try coffee spot if you're in the neighborhood or go through this part of town.

excerpts: The avocado toast was okay.
Too bad.
I am always on the hunt for good local options but this one definitely did not stand up to the 4.5 stars on yelp.
avocado toast.author: S L.
avocado toast.review: Cute little place good for some casual reading time but the drinks and food items were a bit underwhelming. My black sesame latte lacked flavor, the coffee was a bit sour, the matcha waffle didn't impress my son at all. The avocado toast was okay. Too bad. I am always on the hunt for good local options but this one definitely did not stand up to the 4.5 stars on yelp.

excerpts: I got a London Fog hot tea which was AMAZING and the avocado toast which was also mind blowing.
Positives: drink was great and sweet, toast was on really soft brioche like bread (nice and thick)
, avocado was super fresh, egg was just the right amount of soft.
Negatives: the tea comes in a tiny cup so you are paying like $4 for an x-small drink (done in 3 sips)
and they don't have a "large" option only 1 size.
Toast is $9.
My entire order ended up being $17 with tip and tax which seems steep for a coffee shop.
But wifi is good and nice baristas.
avocado toast.author: Brenda I.
avocado toast.review: Loved this cafe in the Richmond. I got a London Fog hot tea which was AMAZING and the avocado toast which was also mind blowing. Positives: drink was great and sweet, toast was on really soft brioche like bread (nice and thick), avocado was super fresh, egg was just the right amount of soft. Negatives: the tea comes in a tiny cup so you are paying like $4 for an x-small drink (done in 3 sips) and they don't have a "large" option only 1 size. Toast is $9. My entire order ended up being $17 with tip and tax which seems steep for a coffee shop. But wifi is good and nice baristas.

excerpts: The corn toast is my favorite food item and my friends love the avocado toast.
Great spot to study, do a little work, catch up with friends, and people watch.
Check them out!
avocado toast.author: Brendon L.
avocado toast.review: To say I've been here a few times is an understatement. The staff is always warm and welcoming. The black sesame latte and the cookie butter latte are my favorites. The corn toast is my favorite food item and my friends love the avocado toast. Great spot to study, do a little work, catch up with friends, and people watch. Check them out!

excerpts: They serve their iced dine in drinks in mason jars ( all the rage) but their avocado toast has hard boiled eggs on it ( a usual safe vegan option)
avocado toast.author: Vee R.
avocado toast.review:
Went to this spot 2 days in a row in my 3 day stay in San Francisco. It was close by to our air bnb and seemed cool. The first day my friend got iced mocha and I had a soy chai latte .. both were good. The next day was as if it was a totally different place. My friend got a vanilla latte this time and I got the same soy ice chai latte ... the soy chai latte tasted like a Luke warm cup of soy milk. The latte was okay, but not worthy of a repeat purchase. 

We also had the Belgian waffle which was dry and barely had anything on it  .. they had no syrup. When I asked for syrup the girl said " we don't have it.. that's why we put the icing on it".  Which would be fine! If there was enough of it. 

But, my biggest issue with this place was their effort to be hip and cool ... being met with not a single vegetarian / vegan or progressive food option ... there is pepperoni on one of the menu items and this to me is just careless. They serve their iced dine in drinks in mason jars ( all the rage) but their avocado toast has hard boiled eggs on it ( a usual safe vegan option) 

Overall this place doesn't seem consistent. To go two days in a row and have a completely different experience the second day is concerning. Also, get some vegan options... this is San Francisco and it's 2017.

excerpts: They have an avocado toast to die for, as well as creative lattes and tasty cookies.
The owners are super friendly and really make an effort to get to know you.
This has become a regular go-to spot for me and a place I take my friends whenever they visit from out of town.
avocado toast.author: Michael H.
avocado toast.review: This coffee shop is a breath of fresh air in the Inner Richmond. They have an avocado toast to die for, as well as creative lattes and tasty cookies. The owners are super friendly and really make an effort to get to know you. This has become a regular go-to spot for me and a place I take my friends whenever they visit from out of town.

excerpts:
My wife and I came here and got an Organic Seven Bridges pour over, a cold brew, and the avocado toast. 

The cold brew was equally as good. 

The avocado toast really stole the show though.
avocado toast.author: Connor O.
avocado toast.review:
This new coffee house is awesome. My wife and I came here and got an Organic Seven Bridges pour over, a cold brew, and the avocado toast. 

The coffee was excellent. Balanced, flavorful, and not sour or bitter. The cold brew was equally as good. 

The avocado toast really stole the show though. It came out on 1-inch thick pieces of toasted white bread with an avocado spread that reminded me of deviled eggs (I think they whip the avocado with mayo and some light mustard seed) and a perfectly cooked soft-boiled egg. 

This place also gets top marks for customer service! They were super friendly with our pooch, giving her treats and they were friendly and engaging during and after the transaction. 

Overall, we love our new neighborhood coffee shop. We will absolutely be coming here regularly.

excerpts: I also like their take on avocado toast.
avocado toast.author: Kristy M.
avocado toast.review: This plc has become a regular weekly coffee spot for me and I don't even live in the Richmond. They have super creative drinks like the whopper latte that's delicious and it isn't made too sweet. I also like their take on avocado toast.

excerpts: Great coffee, incredible food (get the avocado toast) and the service is out of this world.
So happy to have this place in our neighborhood!
avocado toast.author: Maggie H.
avocado toast.review: The most amazing coffee shop in the city.. and dog friendly. Great coffee, incredible food (get the avocado toast) and the service is out of this world. So happy to have this place in our neighborhood!

excerpts: I ordered the avocado toast with no peppers and the waffle.
After what seemed like a long wait, the toast came with peppers.
I didn't feel like waiting another 10 mins to have them fix it.
I ended up eating the toast as my kids didn't like pepper
so they ate the waffle.
Overall, I would probably not order the food again.
avocado toast.author: Jen T.
avocado toast.review: I was looking for a place to grab a quick bite with my kids after a visit from the Academy of Sciences. I ordered the avocado toast with no peppers and the waffle. After what seemed like a long wait, the toast came with peppers. I didn't feel like waiting another 10 mins to have them fix it. I ended up eating the toast as my kids didn't like pepper so they ate the waffle. Overall, I would probably not order the food again. I did get the drip coffee and it was good and strong.

excerpts: My usual go to is the cold brew, avocado toast, and the beer & bacon muffin.
I can't recommend this place enough!
avocado toast.author: Richard W.
avocado toast.review: I love coming to Rise and Grind to either work, read, or grab coffee with a friend. The cafe has a modern industrial look to it and has a very comfortable atmosphere to it. The staff and owners, Vy and Vashelle, are beyond amazing and friendly people. They will go the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied and happy. Rise & Grind serves delicious coffee, pastries, and toast. My usual go to is the cold brew, avocado toast, and the beer & bacon muffin. I can't recommend this place enough!

excerpts: Whether you are in a hurry and want to call in your order for a quick pick up or take your time sitting in to enjoy your matcha waffle and latte art, this is the place.
matcha waffle.author: Amy T.
matcha waffle.review:
Loved my experience at this trendy coffee shop tucked away on this residential block right off Park Presidio.

London Fog - this is one of the better Earl Grey lattes that I've had! The milk supports the Early Grey tea very well, the tea still comes through strong. 

Avocado Toast - Runny, fried egg sits atop of a bed of mashed avocado smeared across a comfy, thick piece of toast. Garnished with red pepper flakes. Yum! 

Salted Caramel Latte - A solid caramel latte. The latte art was definitely a plus!

Matcha Waffles - MMmmatcha! Comes in 4 pieces, toasted and drizzled over by a matcha/condensed milk syrup. The edges were a little overdone but I loved this nonetheless! Especially the sauce.

Their menu definitely stands out, at least this is the first time I have ever seen Whopper Latte on a menu. Whether you are in a hurry and want to call in your order for a quick pick up or take your time sitting in to enjoy your matcha waffle and latte art, this is the place.

excerpts: I ordered the matcha waffle recently, and it was so satisfying!
St first glance, I thought it might be overly sweet
but it was mildly sweet and just right!
It's a tad bit on the dry side, or rather on the cakey side, but I didn't mind that since there was ample sauce and since I had my London fog latte.
matcha waffle.author: Angie Y.
matcha waffle.review:
I've had their cafe au lait (smooth), almond latte (strong), and their London fog latte (smooth & sweet but not too sweet). All are good, but my favorite so far is the London fog latte! The aroma is so pleasant and it's just so tasty! I ordered the matcha waffle recently, and it was so satisfying! St first glance, I thought it might be overly sweet but it was mildly sweet and just right! It's a tad bit on the dry side, or rather on the cakey side, but I didn't mind that since there was ample sauce and since I had my London fog latte. The two actually went really well together! 

Overall, I enjoy it here and will be coming back! There's limited seating, but I've been able to grab a seat each time. The wifi worked for me one time and then it didn't recently. My friend was with me and if didn't work for her either. I'm not sure if it's their internet or if it's our laptops, so I just used my personal hotspot... no big deal.

excerpts: Matcha waffle and avocado toast is fresh and perfectly portioned and cooked.
matcha waffle.author: Kwiri Y.
matcha waffle.review:
5 out of 5 stars on yelp was not a disappointment. 

Small cafe with lot of people studying in the cafe. Not a typical brunch hangout joint despite all the amazing latte art and delicious food photos on yelp and Instagram, so make sure to set your expectations. 

I went with a group of 4 people and it took a while to wait for a table to open even though it was a rainy day with no wait. 

All the staff are all incredibly accommodating and thoughtful. Amazing service and pride to their food and drinks. One of the most interesting and delicious cafe experience I've had and was totally worth tracking out little far from the city to try it out. 

The black sesame latte and creme Brûlée latte was delicious! Matcha waffle and avocado toast is fresh and perfectly portioned and cooked. 

Street parking and dog friendly cafe.

excerpts: The Matcha waffle and the black sesame latte were delicious.
The waffle (6.25 not bad) wasn't too sweet and with just the right amount of syrup so that it wasn't to dry.
The taste of matcha was just right as well.
matcha waffle.author: Jennifer H.
matcha waffle.review:
The Matcha waffle and the black sesame latte were delicious. The waffle (6.25 not bad) wasn't too sweet and with just the right amount of syrup so that it wasn't to dry. The taste of matcha was just right as well. Gotta try the Ube waffle next time! 

Everyone was super friendly, and there was a decent amount of space making it a great spot to work as well!

excerpts: I got the vanilla latte and the matcha waffle.
The waffle was sweet and yummy but didnt taste the first thing like matcha, so if you want just a sweet, green-colored, insta-worthy waffle I suggest it.
The latte was also insta-worthy but otherwise unremarkable.
To me the place felt like its entire point was aesthetic, with no real hospitality or quality.
Won't go back.
matcha waffle.author: Laura G.
matcha waffle.review:
My friend and I came here on a Sunday afternoon. The place was understandably crowded, but for a small caffe there were an awful lot of people just sitting around with empty coffee cups, studying or just doing nothing at all. My friend and I had to squeeze standing into a one-person space at the bar because some girl next to us was watching youtube and nursing a soda. If you have a popular and small place and you're going to ask 'for here or to go', you might want to make sure tweens arent taking up all your space all day. Perhaps establish a time limit, ask people to leave soon after they finish their drink/snack, or at least put up signs asking your patrons to be courteous.
I got the vanilla latte and the matcha waffle. The waffle was sweet and yummy but didnt taste the first thing like matcha, so if you want just a sweet, green-colored, insta-worthy waffle I suggest it. The latte was also insta-worthy but otherwise unremarkable.
To me the place felt like its entire point was aesthetic, with no real hospitality or quality. Won't go back.

excerpts: I had the organic matcha waffle, which was worth trying but slightly over-saturated with matcha powder.
I hope this place sticks around.
I enjoy coming here on the weekends on my way to GG park.
matcha waffle.author: Annie R.
matcha waffle.review: Neighborhood gem of a coffee shop.  Great service, atmosphere.  Nice selection of espresso drinks (black sesame latte - yum!) and breakfast options.  I had the organic matcha waffle, which was worth trying but slightly over-saturated with matcha powder.  I hope this place sticks around.  I enjoy coming here on the weekends on my way to GG park.

excerpts: And their matcha waffle was an elegant classic.
On a sunday midmorning, it was packed.
Kinda pricey, bur worth the splurge for great and creative coffees.
matcha waffle.author: Emily C.
matcha waffle.review: Creme brulee latte was expertly done. And their matcha waffle was an elegant classic. On a sunday midmorning, it was packed. Kinda pricey, bur worth the splurge for great and creative coffees.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I ordered the matcha waffle, the girl got our order wrong and gave us a snooty attitude saying she "heard Belgian.
The waffle was ok, gave us very little syrup
so it was a bit dry.
matcha waffle.author: Jasmin L.
matcha waffle.review: Came across this place and was so excited to try it. Very disappointed. My boyfriend and I ordered the matcha waffle, the girl got our order wrong and gave us a snooty attitude saying she "heard Belgian." The waffle was ok, gave us very little syrup so it was a bit dry. We got the mint cold brew which was good, not too minty but still had a hint. The service was very upsetting we got such snooty vibes from all of them. Prices are ok. We will not be going back.

excerpts: My favorite is the Matcha waffle.
matcha waffle.author: Niko L.
matcha waffle.review:
Rise & Grind is without a doubt the best coffee/tea shop in the Richmond District quite possibly in San Francisco. Everything on the menu from the food to the drinks is delicious, but it's all also uniquely one of a kind. I live down the street from Rise & Grind and couldn't have been more pleased to have a local coffee spot with great food and even nicer employees open when they did a few months ago. They have a variety of specialty drinks like the creme brulee latte, cookie butter latte and their newly added Richmond chill, which is their version of Vietnamese coffee with espresso and condensed milk shaken up in a cocktail mixer. If you're not a big coffee drinker I highly recommend the London fog.

I've tried almost all of the food items and have to put the Avocado Toast at the top of the list; a delicious thick piece of toast topped with a nice hearty spread of fresh avocado, red chili flakes, and a soft boiled egg. It will surely leave you full for hours. The breakfast biscuit is another one of my favorites as well as the Pesto Toast (AMAZING), but their variety of waffles if especially delicious and one of a kind. My favorite is the Matcha waffle. Try it, you're taste buds will thank me.

Along with all the great menu items, the environment and staff are something that makes Rise & Grind especially enjoyable for me. The owners have gone out of their way to put local artists work on the walls and the business has a number of regulars you'll often see every time you go in. There's a great communal and hospitable vibe that keeps me coming back for more. To add to all the greatness of Rise & Grind, there is Cori the corgi, the resident dog who sets up camp at the spot every day and greets customers with a big smile. He's always willing to be played with and adds to the greatness of the baristas. If I could, I'd give Rise & Grind 10 stars but Yelp only lets me give 5. This is a must try coffee spot if you're in the neighborhood or go through this part of town.

excerpts: My black sesame latte lacked flavor, the coffee was a bit sour, the matcha waffle didn't impress my son at all.
matcha waffle.author: S L.
matcha waffle.review: Cute little place good for some casual reading time but the drinks and food items were a bit underwhelming. My black sesame latte lacked flavor, the coffee was a bit sour, the matcha waffle didn't impress my son at all. The avocado toast was okay. Too bad. I am always on the hunt for good local options but this one definitely did not stand up to the 4.5 stars on yelp.

excerpts: I also ordered a Pesto Toast ($7) which was yummy!
Pesto, Cheese, Pepperoni, Tomatoes...
pesto toast.author: Tiffany N.
pesto toast.review:
*Came here on a Wednesday around 1pm and stayed until 3. During this time the cafe was quiet and mostly empty, which was perfect for getting some work done. There was plenty of seats, so no need to fight over tables. 

*There were a few items on the menu that looked unique. I ordered the Creme Brulee Latte ($5) which to my surprise came out with a crunchy caramelized top just like a creme brulee! It was sweet, might be too sweet for some, so I personally wouldn't order it again. I also ordered a Pesto Toast ($7) which was yummy! Pesto, Cheese, Pepperoni, Tomatoes...It tasted like a slice of pesto pizza lol

*Service was friendly. My drink came out quickly and my food came out maybe 10 minutes later. You clean up your own table at the end. 

* I got lucky and parking was easy to find during the weekday/work hours. However, I can imagine that it might not always be the case, and might need to find parking a few blocks away next time.

excerpts: Pesto Toast ($6.75) - Thick (but soft) toast with melted cheese, tomatoes, and slices of pepperoni.
pesto toast.author: Cecille W.
pesto toast.review:
Cute and busy neighborhood coffee shop with a variety of food! 

Mint Cold Brew ($5) - Kind of tastes like the mint mojito coffee at Philz, but with homemade mint syrup! Minty, smooth, and strong! A great iced coffee. 

Vanilla Latte with soy ($4) - +$0.60 for soy. Light and creamy latte with a good amount of foam and vanilla flavor. Not too sweet. Loved this although I wish I ventured out and tried one of their specialty lattes! 

Pesto Toast ($6.75) - Thick (but soft) toast with melted cheese, tomatoes, and slices of pepperoni. Loooved this, and reasonably priced. 

Breakfast bunwich Sandwich ($7.50) - Pretty decent sandwich, with bacon, boiled egg, avocado, and thousand island dressing, but I would say it's a little overpriced for the size of it. Comes warm wrapped in foil. 

Avocado toast ($9.25) - I really really love avocado toast but I can't justify the price of this! Almost $10 for a thick piece of toast, soft boiled egg, and chili flakes. Although this was delicious, it's definitely overpriced compared to other places where I paid around $7 for the same thing. You can choose either a fried egg or soft boiled. 

For two people our total was $33, which we thought was a bit expensive for everything but we enjoyed our breakfast nonetheless. Very cute interior with a good amount of tables and seating. Definitely want to try the matcha waffles and specialty lattes next time!

excerpts: For food, we couldn't help but try the pesto toast and the Belgium waffle.
Both were cooked to perfection, soo delicious!!
pesto toast.author: Monica-Leah A.
pesto toast.review: Absolutely looove this cafe! Such a cute spot to grab some coffee and a bite to eat. Came here with a friend in the search for a good cup of coffee. For food, we couldn't help but try the pesto toast and the Belgium waffle. Both were cooked to perfection, soo delicious!! As for drinks, we tried the peanut butter latte, creme brûlée latte, and the cookie butter latte. They all had a subtle taste of flavor which was delicious and just how I like it! Will definitely be coming back here to try more things!

excerpts: I've only tried the pesto toast, and while it was a little pricey at $6.50, it was very tasty.
I liked that the pesto wasn't incredibly oily and that the tomatoes and pepperoni were evenly distributed throughout, and I loved how the crispy crust contrasted with the fluffy inside of the bread.
pesto toast.author: KC W.
pesto toast.review:
My new favorite study spot!! I usually never drink coffee because it tends to just put me to sleep (yes I'm weird, I know) but I actually feel caffeinated with their drinks. I highly recommend the mint cold brew, which has a nice subtle mint flavor and isn't bitter like regular black coffee. The creme brûlée latte is delicious as well - not overly sweet, and they even torch the drink just like regular creme brûlée. 

They also have toasts and pastries not displayed on the menu above the register. I've only tried the pesto toast, and while it was a little pricey at $6.50, it was very tasty. I liked that the pesto wasn't incredibly oily and that the tomatoes and pepperoni were evenly distributed throughout, and I loved how the crispy crust contrasted with the fluffy inside of the bread. The avocado toast seems to be a popular item as well, although I haven't tried it. Food can be a little slow to come out, but they're very accommodating of any special requests. 

The atmosphere of this coffeeshop definitely bumps up my rating to five stars. The owners are both super friendly and welcoming as soon as customers walk in the door, and the decorations are so unique. I especially like the signs in the restroom and randomly misspelled words hanging on the walls LOL. However, the absolute best part is Cory, the owners' pet corgi!! He's social and very distracting when I'm trying to get work done, but also incredibly well behaved. There's not a whole lot of seating but it's spacious enough for people to do work, and they have a bunch of power strips lining the walls too.

Bottom line: strong coffee, delicious food, cute puppy!
